title: endermite
body:
Small, purple, [[bug]]-like hostile mob in [[Minecraft]]. There is a small chance of an endermite to spawn as the result of throwing an ender pearl. 

Similar to the [[silverfish (Minecraft)]], it has 8 health points (4 hearts) but deals slightly higher attack damage and looks shorter compared to its grey counterpart. An endermite can upset any [[enderman]] on sight within range of 64 blocks, causing them to chase and attack it. 

Affected by the Bane of Anthropods [[enchantment (minecraft)|]]. Drops nothing but few [[experience orb]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Endermite":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Endermite

title: elder_guardian_(minecraft)
body:
Stronger, larger counterpart of the [[Guardian (minecraft)|Guardians]] in [[Minecraft]]. Grey in color, they are seen protecting ocean monuments. Their special ability is causing mining fatigue effect that significantly slows down the player's speed of breaking blocks and attack speed.

other_names: エルダーガーディアン

title: projekt_red_(arknights)
body:
[i]Projekt Red the Wolf Hunter, Specialist Operator of Rhodes Island, will join the hunt.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 25[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Lupo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]162 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]9 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An individual with an unknown identity and mysterious background. She was taken in, raised, and protected by Dr. [[Kal'tsit (arknights)|]]. Extremely talented in high mobility warfare, special ops and stealth combat. Projekt Red now serves as a member of Rhodes Island S.W.E.E.P. internal purge force under Dr. Kal'tsit's guidance. She uses throwing knives as her weapon of choice.

For some reason, all Lupo operators seem to try their best to avoid her.

Her motif is based on gray wolves. Her callsign is a homage to the developer of [i]The Witcher[/i] video game series, [i]CD Projekt Red[/i].

Thanks to one of her lines where she admits she wants to touch the tails of her fellow Lupos, this has led to jokes by fans that Projekt Red is a Tail Pervert that wants to touch other operators fluffy tails and real reason why the other Lupos operators avoid her.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Koshimizu Ami]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3563895: Default
* !post #3563897: Elite II
* !post #4679503: [[projekt_red_(light_breeze)_(arknights)|Light Breeze]]

title: drowned_(minecraft)
body:
[[Undead]] [[zombie|hostile mob]] in [[Minecraft]] that spawns [[underwater]], identifiable by the blue-colored skin. Very few of them are armed with a [[trident]]. They are also decent source of copper [[steel ingot|ingots]].

Regular [[zombie (minecraft)|zombies]] will turn into Drowned after being submerged for about 30 seconds.

h4. See also

title: charged_creeper
body:
When a [[creeper]] roams the [[Minecraft]] world and gets struck by [[lightning]], it becomes a charged creeper, which has electric blue aura surrounding it. Its [[explosion|explosive]] damage and radius will be much greater.

If certain mobs like a [[zombie (minecraft)|]] or [[piglin]] were killed by its explosion, their heads will drop as collectible items.

h4. See also

title: iron_golem_(minecraft)
body:
A strong neutral mob in [[Minecraft]]. Naturally spawned by multiple [[villager (minecraft)|Villagers]] with jobs and claimed beds. It attacks most hostile and neutral mobs, except [[Creeper|Creepers]]. Drops [[steel ingot|iron ingots]] upon death, often with [[red flower|poppy flowers]].

Players can summon it by arranging four iron blocks in T-shaped formation and placing a carved [[pumpkin]] on top. Player-built Iron Golems do not attack the one who built it.

h4. See also

title: kousaka_reina
body:
Kousaka Reina is a character in [[Hibike! Euphonium]]. She is a highly skilled [[trumpet]] player in Kitauji High School's concert band. She joins in the same year as [[Oumae Kumiko|Kumiko]], and the two form a close friendship.

Reina has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She often wears [[black thighhighs]] with her school uniform. Reina has a serious, driven personality, which intimidates Kumiko at first. She aspires to be a professional trumpet player.

title: ashita_no_joe
body:
[b]Ashita no Joe[/b]  (あしたのジョー , transl. [i]"Tomorrow's Joe"[/i]) is a influential and acclaimed [[Boxing]] Manga created by  Kajiwara Ikki and  Chiba Tetsuya and published on 1968. which had its anime adaptation in 1970, with the second season released in 1980.

The story revolves around [[Yabuki Joe]], a homeless teenager who acts impulsively upon arriving in a small slum in San'ya, [[Tokyo (city)|]]. where he ends up running into another homeless person, [[Tange Danpei]], who is soon revealed to be a former boxer and trainer who was fired because of his aggressive behavior in the rings, in addition to being betrayed by his disciple. Danpei soon notices Joe as an ideal figure as a Boxer for his better future.

But initially Joe rejects Danpei's invitation and ends up committing petty crimes to help the local population. soon he is arrested as a minor offender, but his aggressive attitudes made him go to juvenile prison, where he had to learn hard about what life is.

Everything changes when he meets another prisoner, [[Rikiishi Tooru]], who challenges him to a boxing match. Joe feels motivated by this moment and from there begins the protagonist's story of overcoming and tragedy.

The manga and anime have become important symbols for Japanese animation and society, with numerous parodies involving iconic scenes.

h4. Characters

h5. Main Characters
* [[Yabuki Joe]]
* [[Tange Danpei]]
* [[Rikiishi Tooru]]
* [[Carlos Rivera]]
* [[Shiraki Youko]]

h5. Minor Characters

* [[Sachi (ashita no joe)|]]
* [[Hayashi Noriko]]

h4. See also
* [[Chiba Tetsuya (style)]]
* [[Megalobox]]
* [[Yabuki Joe in a chair (meme)]]

title: megalobox
body:
[b]Megalobox[/b] a Japanese original [[boxing]] anime series produced and animated by TMS Entertainment and its subsidiary 3xCube. Megalobox was created in commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the boxing manga [[Ashita no Joe]].

Set in late 21st century Japan where [[boxer]]s wear [[exoskeleton]]s to fight, the narrative focuses on an underground fighter [[Joe (megalo_box)|]] (also known by his ring name "Junk Dog"), who decides to enter into a boxing competition called Megalonia in order to defeat the champion [[Yuuri (megalo box)|Yuri]].

title: seto_mitsuki
body:
[[Denonbu]] character and member of Teion International High School's electronic music club in Shibuya area. 

Mitsuki has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streak]]. She has yellow-[[green eyes]], and wears two red crossed [[hairclip]]s.

She wears a [[blue dress]] with straps, and a black [[belt]] above her waist. On top of this, she wears a black [[leather jacket]] with a red triangle pin and red accents. Around her neck, she wears a [[black choker]] with red and blue decorations. She also wears black and blue [[ring]]s on her right hand, along with a red triangle ring and a blue [[bracelet]] on her left.

Mitsuki wears [[black socks]], with the [[asymmetrical legwear|right]] reaching to at least her [[skirt]] and the left ending above her knee. She wears black heeled [[boots]] with "PETRICHOR" written on them, along with red zip-ties around them.

h4. Official art

* !post #5658375

title: holostars_idol_uniform_(1st_act)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by the original 9 [[HOLOSTARS]] members for live events and in certain [[promotional art|promotional artworks]], originally designed by [[Nozaki Tsubata]]. The uniform first debuted at the 1st ACT "JOURNEY to FIND STARS!!" live concert in 2021, and is currently considered the standard outfit for the group's idol activities.

Since [[uproar (holostars)|UPROAR!!]] has a different uniform and [[HOLOSTARS English]] hasn’t received theirs, artists may come up with their own interpretations when depicted the members from those groups in this idol outfit. 

h4. Description 
[tn]See post #5235452[/tn]
It consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[white pants]], an [[asymmetrical clothes|asymmetrical]] [[white jacket]] that has longer hem on the left along with [[notched lapels]], [[sleeve cuffs]] and is [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laced]] in the back, a [[double-breasted]] [[black vest]], a [[yellow sash]], a [[side cape|side]] [[capelet]], [[neck ribbon]], [[award ribbon]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[knee boots]]. The color of the capelet, neck ribbon, award ribbon and accent colors differ to match each talent's theme color. They also have accessories unique to each of them (post #5235525):

* [[Hanasaki Miyabi]]: A [[white headwear|white]] [[mini top hat]] with [[hat ribbon]] and [[hat flower]]. 
* [[Kanade Izuru]]: A blue [[floating earring|dangle]] [[single earring]]. 
* [[Arurandeisu]]: A pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[yellow-framed eyewear|gold-framed]] [[glasses]]. 
* [[Rikka_(Holostars)|]]: A [[halo]] and a blue variation of his default earring. 
* [[Astel Leda]]: An [[afro]] as a prank from staffs, though the truth is that he gets a [[official alternate hairstyle|new hairstyle]] instead of an accessory.  
* [[Kishido Temma]]: A [[collar chain (jewelry)|]]. 
* [[Yukoku Roberu]]: An [[ear chain]] and [[ear piercing]]. 
* [[Aragami Oga]]: A [[diamond earrings|diamond-shape]] [[single earring]]. 
* [[Kageyama Shien]]: Two [[ear piercing]]s. 

h4. See also
* [[HOLOSTARS idol uniform (2nd Act)]] - A new idol uniform introduced for the 2nd ACT "GREAT VOYAGE to UNIVERSE!!"

title: vanitas_(vanitas_no_carte)
body:
Title character as well as one of the main characters in [[Vanitas no Carte]].

[b]Vanitas[/b] is a [[doctor]] who specializes in [[vampire]]s. He is an average human being who inherited his name and the Book of Vanitas from the infamous vampire.

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] (that may appear [[blue hair|blue]] due to coloring) tied into a [[low ponytail]] with [[hair between eyes]]. His default outfit included a [[black coat]], [[blue bowtie|blue]] [[striped bowtie]], [[blue vest|blue]] [[striped vest]] on top of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue sash]] tied into a [[waist bow]], [[black pants]], [[black gloves]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[boots]]. He also wears an [[hourglass]]-shaped [[floating earring|dangle]] [[single earring]].

title: nihongami
body: Historical Japanese hairstyles that traditionally denoted an aspect of the wearer's identity, such as their age, societal status or marital status. Most nihongami styles are formed with a wax known as abura. Outside of Japan, the most distinguishable nihongami is that of [[geisha]] and [[oiran]], given their elaborate designs, such as the large [[datehyogo]] style. h5. title: good_morning_my_brother!_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] in [[scene reference|reference]] to [[Tokidoki Bosotto Roshia-go de Dereru Tonari no Alya-san]] episode 2, at time 08:21, where [[Suou Yuki]] decides to [[teasing]]ly [[waking another|wake up]] her [[brother_and_sister|brother]] [[Kuze Masachika]] by [[straddling]] him as he [[lying|lies]] [[on_bed|in bed]] whilst greeting him with a cheery "Good morning, my brother!" in English.

The [[parody|parodies]] of this scene typically feature a character in [[pajamas]] displaying an [[extended downblouse]] and straddling another character. They are frequently of a [[2koma]] format with the first panel showing the downblouse with the character [[leaning forward]], and the second showing the character upright with a [[smug]] expression or [[naughty face]] while [[looking at viewer|looking at the viewer]]. It may be [[subtitled]] with the titular phrase.

h4. Examples

* !post #7853944: Scene posted by the "RoshiDere PR":[https://x.com/roshidere/status/1812426816168022280] Twitter account
* !post #7853660: The meme in 2koma format

title: chengdu_j-7
body:
The [b]Chengdu J-7[/b] (simplified Chinese: 歼-7; traditional Chinese: 殲-7) is license-built copy of the Mikoyan-Gurevich [[MiG-21]] built by the [i]Chengdu Aircraft Industry Group[/i] for the [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] (PLAAF) as a result of a technology transference arrangement in 1962. While externally it is identical to the MiG-21, the Soviet Union failed to transfer the complete documentation for the MiG-21, resulting in Chinese engineers having to reverse engineer the missing components from locally sourced parts. Thus, the internal hydraulics system, ejection system, fuel tanks, and canopy ejection system are unique to the J-7.

An export version is known as the F-7 Airguard. Armament includes 2 30mm [[cannon]] plus infrared air-to-air missiles, rockets, and bombs.

h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Chengdu J-7":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chengdu_J-7

title: caloriemate
body:
CalorieMate (カロリーメイト) is a brand of energy-supplement foods produced by Otsuka Pharmaceutical Co., in Japan. It was first released in 1983 debuting with the cheese-flavored block.

CalorieMate comes in several forms, including Block, Jelly, and Can. CalorieMate Block (カロリーメイト ブロック) resembles a bar-shaped cookie (somewhat like a shortbread), sold in packs of either two or four. CalorieMate Jelly (カロリーメイト ゼリー) is gelatin sold in a pouch with a spout. CalorieMate Can (カロリーメイト 缶) is a canned drink. The packaging is quite plain, almost generic. ~Wikipedia

Being a well-known supplemental food in Japan, it has appeared in various Japanese subcultures, such as [[Metal Gear Solid]] 3 and 4.

h4. See also

* [[Pocari Sweat]] - produced by the same company
* [[candy bar]] - bar shaped but candy

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: CalorieMate":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CalorieMate]

title: battlecruiser
body:
A type of 20th century [[warship]], generally characterized by the possession of similar or slightly lighter armament than a [[battleship]] but with the armor and speed of a [[cruiser]]. They originated in the Royal Navy as an evolution of earlier armored cruisers around the same time as the dreadnoughts. 

The definition of battlecruiser can be somewhat murky as multiple different nations built/designed them under different design philosophies, requirements, and designations (such as the US designating some as "large cruisers"). Additionally, the distinction between a battlecruiser and a fast battleship is blurred, especially with later designs and remodels.

This page is about real life warship class. For spaceship appearing in [[Starcraft]] games, use [[Battlecruiser (Starcraft)]] instead.

As with [[warship]], this tag should [b]not[/b] be used for [[personification]]s of warships (such as those from [[Kantai Collection]]), it is instead for images featuring actual warships as built/designed in reality.

title: star_wars:_attack_of_the_clones
body:
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones is a [[2002]] American epic space opera film directed by [[George Lucas]] and written by Lucas and Jonathan Hales. The sequel to [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace]] (1999), it is the fifth film in the [[Star Wars]] film series and second chronological chapter of the Saga. The film stars [[Ewan McGregor]], [[Natalie Portman]], [[Hayden Christensen]], Ian McDiarmid, [[Samuel L. Jackson]], [[Christopher Lee]], Anthony Daniels, Kenny Baker, and Frank Oz. 
The story is set ten years after The Phantom Menace, as thousands of planetary systems slowly secede from the Galactic Republic and join the newly formed Confederacy of Independent Systems, led by former Jedi Master [[Count Dooku]]. With the galaxy on the brink of civil war, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] investigates a mysterious assassination attempt on Senator [[Padme Amidala]], which leads him to uncover a clone army in service of the Republic and the truth behind the Separatist movement. Meanwhile, his apprentice [[Anakin Skywalker]] is assigned to protect Amidala and develops a secret romance with her. Soon, the trio witness the onset of a new threat to the galaxy: [[Star Wars:  the clone wars|The Clone Wars]].

[[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]] (2005) followed Attack of the Clones, concluding the Star Wars prequel trilogy.

h4. See also
* [[For the Better Right? (Meme)]]

title: wz.96_beryl
body:
Polish standard infantry rifle chambered in 5.56 NATO. A modernised Wz.88 "Tantal" wich was loosely based around the AK-74 and several polish prototypes, most notably being the only eastern rifle to incorporate a rachet 3-round burst that passed on to the Beryl.

The name "Beryl" means "berylium" in polish and it is the rifle's disignation given to after it's introduction. In the polish military firearms were traditionally designated after periodic table elements and minerals eg. Wz.88 Tantal (tantalium), P83 Wanad (vanadium), WKW Tor (thorium), PM84 Glauberyt (glauberite).

title: marmite
body:
[b]Marmite[/b] is a dark, brown food paste made of Yeast extract and originally from the [[United Kingdom]].

Due to Marmite's distinctive, salty and powerful savoury flavour, it has a reputation for being a "Love it or Hate it" food since people either love or hate the taste. Marmite is popular in the UK,  Commonwealth nations and some South East Asia countries since the paste is used as a savoury condiment for rice porridge.

See also [[Vegemite]], a similar paste also made from yeast extract from [[Australia]] albeit Marmite's yeast extract comes from Brewery Yeast while Vegemite is made from a combination of brewery yeast, vegetables and spice additives.

Similar looking to sweet jams from other countries and cultures, more than one foreign tourist has been unpleasantly surprised by its extremely sour and salty flavor....

h4. See also
* [[tag group:food tags]]

title: galacta_knight
body:
A recurring boss character in the [i][[kirby_(series)|Kirby]][/i] series. He makes his debut in [i][[Kirby Super Star Ultra]][/i] at the very end of the [i]Meta Knightmare Ultra[/i] subgame, where [[Meta Knight]] summons [[Galactic Nova]] to wish for a fight against him. Since then, he has made various re-appearances as a secret superboss in future [i]Kirby[/i] games ([i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i], its [[kirby's_return_to_dream_land_deluxe|remake]] and [i][[Kirby: Planet Robobot]][/i] to be exact). In [i][[Kirby: Star Allies]][/i], however, a "[[morpho_knight|fluttery fiend]]" absorbs him and is fought instead.

He is the strongest warrior in the galaxy in Kirby's world and was sealed away because he was deemed too strong. [spoiler]([[Star Dream]] even suggests that he may have destroyed at least one planet in the past). 

[spoiler]He also appears in [i][[Super Kirby Clash]][/i] as a true final boss, surprisingly enough. Here, he is dubbed "Aeon Hero", and counts with two powered-up forms -Light and Dark- that change his appearance. He is also implied to be one of the ancient heroes who sealed away [[Void Termina]] long ago, as he attacks using the spears of the heart that kept the Dark Lord in place.[/spoiler]
H4. External links
* "WiKirby: Galacta Knight":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Galacta_Knight

title: nekopara
body:
A visual novel revolving around [[Sayori (neko works)|]]'s original [[cat girl]] characters. Localized to English by "Sekai Project":[http://www.sekaiproject.com/].

So far, there are five "episodes" in the series:

h6. Episode 0

Episode 0, which is counter-intuitively the second novel released, is a short "fandisk" that takes place before the events of episode 1, and gives the player character's sister a much larger role. It's also somewhat of a showcase of new features not present in the first game, which include the ability to directly interact with the cast by clicking on them.

h6. Episode 1

Episode 1, the first novel released, centers on the characters [[Chocola (nekopara)|]] and [[Vanilla (nekopara)|]], whom the main character lives with, sleeps with and eventually has sex with. While Chocola and Vanilla are the main characters, the novel also includes a supporting cast of four other cat girls and the player character's sister.

h6. Episode 2

Episode 2, the third novel released, adds [[Coconut (nekopara)|]] and [[Azuki (nekopara)|]] to the center character group. The two were formerly members of the supporting cast. 

h6. Episode 3

Episode 3, the fourth novel released, focuses on [[Cinnamon (nekopara)|]] and [[Maple (nekopara)|]]. As with [[Coconut (nekopara)|]] and [[Azuki (nekopara)|]] before them, they started as supporting characters.

h6. Episode 4

The fifth novel released, Episode 4 focuses on the player character [[Minazuki Kashou]] and his family, exploring his past. It also introduces a new supporting character, [[Fraise (nekopara)|]].

An otome game spinoff titled [[Nekopara - Catboys Paradise]] was released in 2021. The spinoff was originally presented simply as an April Fool's joke in 2019, but due to unexpected high demand, it would later be made into a full game.

h4. Characters

* [[Chocola_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Vanilla_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Coconut_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Azuki_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Cinnamon_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Maple_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Minazuki Kashou]]
* [[Minazuki Shigure]]
* [[Milk_(nekopara)|]]
* [[Fraise_(nekopara)|]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":[http://nekopara.com]

title: olympic_shooting_glasses
body:
Standard-issued [[glasses]] designed to be used by competitors of the international shooting tournament, especially the [[Olympics]].

It consists of a single lens placed on the shooter's preferred eye, and a black plate blocking the other, with the intention to help the wearer to better focus on the target.

title: zhuge_kongming_(honkai_impact)
body:
The Princess and Grand Seeress of the Emberyan empire, and a bubble world version of [[Theresa Apocalypse]]. She first appears near the end of the "Odd Drifter" event as the one who masterminds the whole event in order to fix the anomaly that the [[Captain (honkai impact)|]] accidentally caused, and later appears in "Honkai Kingdoms: Zero" event, receiving Captain's help to slay a certain Beast that threatens her country. She becomes the main focus in "The Day You Vanished with the Stars".

Initially available as a stigmata set, she becomes playable as Theresa's Starlit Astrologos battlesuit.
other_names: 諸葛孔明・星詠の朔夜

title: theresa_apocalypse_(luna_kindred)
body:

She and her [[theresa apocalypse (lunar vow: crimson love)|older]] version are playable as Theresa Battlesuits.

title: lackadaisy
body:
Lackadaisy is a webcomic created by American artist [[Tracy J. Butler]] in 2006. Set in a Prohibition-era St. Louis with a population of anthropomorphic cats, the plot chronicles the fortunes of the Lackadaisy speakeasy after its founder is murdered. The comic mixes elements of comedy, crime and mystery. It won multiple Web Cartoonists' Choice Awards, and it was nominated for the Eisner Award for "Best Digital Comic". (wiki)

h4. Characters

* [[Ivy Pepper]]
* [[Rocky Rickaby]]
* [[Mordecai Heller]]
* [[Calvin Freckle Mcmurray]]


h4. External links
* https://lackadaisy.com/
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lackadaisy

title: thai_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] worn by [[Thailand|Thai]] students, derivative of the Japanese [[school uniform]]. The girl's uniform mainly consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[long skirt]] (usually in black or indigo), and an optional small [[ribbon]]. The boy's uniform consists of a white collared shirt and a black/indigo [[short shorts]].

Older generation of Thai conservatives regarded the school uniform as "honourable" and considered it a taboo to associate it with any indecent things. Newer generations of Thai artists have developed a counter-culture around the uniform by playing with common taboos, such as sexual indecency and [[prostitution]].

h4.See also
* [[Thai college uniform]]

body:
[b]Marnie[/b], known as [b]Mary[/b] (マリィ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Trainer from Spikemuth in the Galar region hopes to become Champion to liven up her hometown. Her battle tactics and cute appearance have earned her many fans. Her first Pokémon is [[Morpeko]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with [[undercut]] [[asymmetrical bangs]]. She wears [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]], [[earrings]], a [[black choker|choker]], a [[pink dress]] under an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket]], [[black nails|black]] [[nail polish]], [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots|boots]], and a [[red bag|red]] [[backpack]].

title: cbj-ms
body:
[b]CBJ-MS[/b] is a Swedish made personal defense weapon / [[submachine gun]]. Designed and manufactured by Swedish weapon developer CBJ Tech AB, and was also manufactured by "Saab Bofors Dynamics":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saab_Bofors_Dynamics]. It can be chambered for both 9×19mm and higher-velocity "6.5×25mm CBJ":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/6.5×25mm_CBJ] [[ammunition|cartridges]] via simple barrel changes.

Quite similar to the [[Uzi]] for having open bolt mechanism and magazine inserted to the grip. The gun features a top-mounted Picatinny rail for mounting [[optical sight|optics]], a progressive trigger for semi- and fully automatic fire, a collapsing wire stock, a grip safety, a threaded barrel, and a hollow foregrip which can be used to hold a spare [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. Feed system comes in 20 or 30-round detachable box magazine and 100-round [[drum magazine|drum one]].

h4. See also

* [[C-MS (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Saab Bofors Dynamics CBJ-MS":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saab_Bofors_Dynamics_CBJ-MS]

title: pasgt_helmet
body:
A type of combat [[helmet]] and that was used by the [[United States]] [[military]] from the early 1980s until the mid-2000s, along with the PASGT [[bulletproof vest]]. First adopted in 1983. The name is acronym for [b]Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops[/b]. The helmet is still in use by military and [[police]] forces in many countries. It is also popular with the press and journalists.

The helmet was initially called "The Fritz" because of its similiarity to the old [[germany|German]] [[Stahlhelm]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Personnel Armor System for Ground Troops":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personnel_Armor_System_for_Ground_Troops]

title: rutger_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]]. The first recruitable enemy in the game, and the first playable unit in the Myrmidon class.

A man of half-Sacaean, half-Bern descent, Rutger grew up in the Sacaean capital of Bulgar. At the onset of the Disturbance of Bern, he saw how Bern's forces, led by Wyvern General [[Brunnya (Fire Emblem)|Brunnya]], decimated the city and slaughtered its populace. As one of the few survivors of the Battle of Bulgar, left alive because Bern's soldiers mistook him for one of their own, Rutger swore to avenge his fallen people by exacting vengeance upon Bern. After rescuing [[Clarine (Fire Emblem)|Clarine]] from [[Narcian (Fire Emblem)|Narcian]]'s clutches, she recruits him into Roy's army. From there on, Rutger fights under the Lycian and Etrurian banners on his quest for vengeance.

Rutger has [[medium hair|mid-length]] [[brown hair]] and sharp [[brown eyes]]. His signature outfit is his [[hood|hooded]] [[red coat|red]] [[coat]] adorned with a [[belt]]. He also wears [[brown pants|brown]] [[pants]].

Rutger is curt, terse and dour. He prefers to be left to his own devices rather than socializing with people. He admits to using his sword to kill, which is why he prefers not to become anyone's training partner, as he wouldn't want anyone else to go down a bloodied path like his own. Rutger also doesn't know what he wants to do after taking vengeance upon Bern.

Rutger is featured in the Fire Emblem Cipher panorama for the Legendary Weapons, wielding [[Durandal (Fire Emblem)|Durandal]].

title: cagliostro_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] character.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], a [[red skirt]] with [[vial|vials]] along the side of it, a [[tiara]]-like [[hairband]], and a [[cape]]. She is always holding a book.

She is actually over 1,000 years old, and is widely known in the Granblue universe as the person who basically invented alchemy. Her original body (which was biologically male) was always of ill health and would've died in adolescence; to avoid such a fate, she learned how to use alchemy to create new bodies and transfer herself into them, thereby living indefinitely. This is how she wound up in her current female body, which she views as her "ideal" form.

Her nickname on the internet is "Uncle Cali" (カリおっさん, Cali-[i]ossan[/i]).

Note that, because her male form was never even seen in-series, Cagliostro's presence only warrants the [[genderswap_(mtf)]] tag if the image references it somehow. See topic #11614 for details.

h4.Official Alternate Costumes

* [[cagliostro_(summer)_(granblue_fantasy)|Summer Cagliostro]]

* [[cagliostro (youthful_uniform) (granblue fantasy)|Youthful Uniform]]

title: watase_kouichi
body:
[b]Watase Kouichi[/b] (JP: [code]渡瀬 公一[/code], [code]わたせ こういち[/code]) is the player of [[Tokimeki Memorial 2]]. He is voiced by [[Kamiya Hiroshi]] in the CD drama version of the game. Born at March 21st and has the blood type of O.

Unlike the [[tokimeki memorial 1|prequel]], he can play from his childhood, playing around with [[Hinomoto Hikari]]. In the high school, he enters the same class as his childhood friend, along with the information [s]shota[/s]broker [[Sakaki Takumi]] and rival [[Hokari Jun'ichirou]]. At first he doesn't belong to any club, meanwhile he is trying to become active in the romance at first but gradually fades while spending ordinary days. He cannot leave a troubled person alone and he must do whatever is asked. He is currently unaware of Hikari's favor.

He is known as Iwase Takeru (JP: [code]岩瀬 健[/code], [code]いわせ たける[/code]) in the game's novelization.

h4. See also

* [[Takami Naoto]]
other_names: 主人公(ときめきメモリアル2)

title: jack_howl
body: Jack Howl is a first-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Savanaclaw. He is a tough delinquent who strictly adheres to hierarchy of power and strives to increase his own strengths. He dislikes associating with others.

title: floyd_leech
body:
Floyd Leech is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Octavinelle. He's [[jade_leech|Jade]]'s twin but their attitude and speech are totally different. He's kind of unpredictable so it's difficult to know what he's thinking.

Although he and Jade look very similar, Floyd is noted as having "messier" clothing than his twin. His bowtie is undone, his shirt is unbuttoned, and his suit is more wrinkled.

title: cheka_kingscholar
body: Cheka Kingscholar is the son of Farena Kingscholar, King of Afterglow Savannah, and [[Leona Kingscholar]]'s nephew in [[Twisted Wonderland]].
other_names: チェカ・キングスカラー

title: epel_felmier
body: Epel Felmier is a first-year student of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Pomefiore. He's a pretty boy who possesses a fragile attractiveness. He does not talk much, and has a mysterious impression.

title: che'nya
body: Alchemi Alchemivich Pinka, better known as Che'nya, is a third-year student of Royal Sword Academy in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He is a childhood friend of [[riddle_rosehearts|Riddle]] and [[trey_clover|Trey]].
other_names: アルチェーミ・アルチェーミエヴィチ・ピンカー

title: najma_viper
body: Najma Viper is the younger sister of [[Jamil Viper]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]].

title: malleus_draconia
body: Malleus Draconia is a third-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the dorm leader of Diasomnia. He is a descendant of the fairies, and his magic power is amongst one of the strongest in the world. He has a distinguished presence at Night Raven College, but his powerful aura causes the other students to keep their distance.
other_names: マレウス・ドラコニア

title: riddle_rosehearts
body: Riddle Rosehearts is a second-year in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the dorm head of Heartslabyul. He strictly upholds strange rules made by the Queen of Hearts. He's feared by the rest of the students because of his severe punishments toward those who break the rules.
other_names: リドル・ローズハート

title: ace_trappola
body: Ace Trappola is a first-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Heartslabyul. He's clever and has a bright personality, but can be a little mean too. He's rivals with [[deuce_spade|Deuce]].

title: deuce_spade
body: Deuce Spade is a first-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Heartslabyul. He enrolled in the school aiming to become a powerful mage. He's very serious, but a little disorganized. He's rivals with [[ace_trappola|Ace]].

title: trey_clover
body: Trey Clover is a third-year and the vice head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Heartslabyul. He's calm and is seen as a protector by the rest. He always backs up the overly-strict [[riddle_rosehearts|Riddle]].

title: cater_diamond
body: Cater Diamond is a third-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Heartslabyul. He's very perceptive with great communication skills, as well as popular, stylish, and a gourmet. However, he can sometimes be cruel.
other_names: ケイト・ダイヤモンド

title: leona_kingscholar
body: Leona Kingscholar is a third-year, and the leader of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Savanaclaw. While he has great magic powers, he doesn't like using much effort, and constantly appears lax and leisurely. He's the second prince of his home country and acts arrogantly toward everyone.
other_names: レオナ・キングスカラー

title: azul_ashengrotto
body: Azul Ashengrotto is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the head of the Octavinelle Dormitory. He manages the Mostro Lounge, a café located in the Octavinelle dormitory building. Though he claims to help others out, the wishes he grants often come at a price.
other_names: アズール・アーシェングロット

title: vil_schoenheit
body: Vil Schoenheit is a third-year student and the head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Pomefiore. He is gorgeous and eye-catching. He thinks he is the most beautiful and spares no effort for beauty.
other_names: ヴィル・シェーンハイト

title: rook_hunt
body: Rook Hunt is a third-year and the vice head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Pomefiore. He loves beautiful things, and appreciates [[vil_schoenheit|Vil]] and [[epel_felmier|Epel]]'s beauty. He's an elusive individual.

title: idia_shroud
body: Idia Shroud is a third-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the head of Ignihyde, as well as [[ortho_shroud|Ortho]]'s "older brother." He is shy and has a dark nature, not wanting to interact with people and staying in his dorm. However, it seems like things are different online.

title: ortho_shroud
body: Ortho Shroud is a member of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Ignihyde and the younger "brother" of [[idia_shroud|Idia]]. He always works with him and has the character of his older brother. In contrast to him, he is bright, honest, and very curious.

title: dire_crowley
body: Dire Crowley is the masked Headmaster of the prestigious magical training school, Night Raven College. His catchphrase is, "Because I'm so kind." After [[Yuu_(twisted_wonderland)|]] ends up lost and is summoned to [[Twisted Wonderland]], he is the one who takes them in and appoints them as Prefect and leader of the Ramshackle Dorm. Supposedly, Crowley is researching ways for Yuu to return to their original world.

title: divus_crewel
body: Divus Crewel is a teacher at Night Raven College in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He teaches science classes like potions. He has very opinionated views when it comes to fashion. Because he's so particular about fashion, he will not allow even the slightest compromise in regards to what he wears.
other_names: デイヴィス・クルーウェル

title: sam_(twisted_wonderland)
body: Sam is a staff member at Night Raven College in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He's known within the school as the owner of Mr. S's Mystery Shop. Though he manages his shop with a cheerful disposition, dealing with an abundance of merchandise ranging from food to magic items, he's always trying to persuade students to purchase his mysterious wares.

title: mozus_trein
body: Mozus Trein is a teacher at Night Raven College in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He teaches liberal art classes like History of Magic, and, though he is strict, he dotes on his cat Lucius. Because he's severe as a teacher even outside of class, many students are afraid of him.

title: ashton_vargas
body: Ashton Vargas is a teacher at Night Raven College in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He teaches subjects such as physical education and flying, and is somewhat of a hot-blooded narcissist. As he believes muscles are vital for magic, he encourages students to train their bodies.
other_names: アシュトン・バルガス

title: neige_leblanche
body: Neige LeBlanche is a second-year student at Royal Sword Academy in [[Twisted Wonderland]]. He is also a popular actor and influencer.
other_names: ネージュ・リュバンシェ

title: jade_leech
body:
Jade Leech is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]], the vice head of Octavinelle, and [[azul_ashengrotto|Azul]]'s assistant as well as [[floyd_leech|Floyd's]] twin.

Although he and Floyd look very similar, Jade is noted as having "neater" clothing than his twin. His bowtie is done, his shirt is buttoned up, and his suit isn't very wrinkled.

h4. Outfits

* [[Jade_Leech_(halloween)|Halloween]]

title: kalim_al-asim
body: Kalim Al-Asim is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the head of Scarabia. Born into a wealthy family, he is very laid-back and generous. He grew up together with [[jamil_viper|Jamil]] and relies on him for everything.
other_names: カリム・アルアジーム

title: jamil_viper
body: Jamil Viper is a second-year student in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the vice head of Scarabia. His ancestors have served the Al-Asim family generation after generation, so he's been dragged around by the careless [[kalim_al-asim|Kalim]] since they were young.

title: onibro_(onigiri)
body:
The real-life brother (and tech supporter) of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie VTuber]] [[Onigiri (vtuber)|]].

Depicted as a [[red skin|red skinned]] [[oni]], he wears a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[floral print|floral printed]] [[shirt]] with [[shorts]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]] worn with [[white socks]].

body:
[[Cow girl]] alchemist [[virtual YouTuber]] from [[Phase Connect]]'s third generation.

Being a cow girl, she natrually has [[cow horns]], [[cow ears]] and a [[cow tail]], she also has [[very long hair|very long]] [[messy hair|messy]] [[purple hair]] and [[pink eyes]]. For her outfit, she wears a [[white coat|white]] [[lab coat]] worn over a [[white shirt|white]] [[frilled shirt|frilled]] [[sleeveless shirt]] a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]], [[white socks]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[animal slippers|cow slippers]].

title: villager_(minecraft)
body:
Passive Overworld mob in [[Minecraft]] that naturally spawns and inhabits [[village]]s. Once a villager gets a job by acquiring nearby utility block, players can trade with them. For instance, an unemployed villager that encounters nearby blast [[furnace]] will turn into an armorer that has a chance to trade an iron chestplate and buy 4 iron ingots for an emerald.

Like the player, villagers have 20 health points (10 hearts) and can wear [[armor]] (only via dispenser, won't be visible on the model). Hitting a villager will cause it to raise trade prices for the player who does so. Continuous aggression towards them, including killing one will eventually cause the [[iron_golem_(minecraft)|iron golems]] spawned by local group of villagers to attack the player.

h4. Appearance and outfit
Villagers have brown skin, [[green eyes]], [[thick eyebrows]], a large rectangular head, and a large hooked nose. 

Their outfit varies depending on their home biome and occupation. For instance, those who spawned in a plains biome wear brown robes, [[librarian]]s wears [[glasses]] and has a [[book on head]], [[farmer]]s wear yellow [[straw hat]]s, et cetra.

h4. See also
* [[Zombie Villager (minecraft)|]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Villager":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Villager

title: jervis_(kancolle)
body:
HMS [i]Jervis[/i], pennant number F00 from 1938 to 1940 and G00 during World War II, as depicted in the game [[Kantai Collection]]. Jervis is the game's first wartime Allied destroyer.

Jervis wears a white [[sailor dress]] with a black cropped blazer over it, [[white gloves]], a white [[sailor hat]], [[white socks]], and [[Mary Janes]]. Among her rigging are her three QF 4.7-inch Mark XII guns. She also holds a cannon gun.

Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

h4. J-Class Destroyers

* [b]Jervis[/b] (F00)
* [[Janus (Kancolle)]] (F53)
* [[Javelin (Kancolle)]] (F61)

h4. See also

* [[Jervis (Azur Lane)]]
* Her other J-class sisters:
** [[Juno (Azur Lane)]] (F46)
** [[Javelin (Azur Lane)]] (F61)
** [[Jersey (Azur Lane)]] (F72)
** [[Jupiter (Azur Lane)]] (F85)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: [i]HMS Jervis[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMS_Jervis]
* "Kancolle Wiki: Jervis":[http://kancolle.wikia.com/wiki/Jervis]

body:
Bipedal, [[red skin|red-skinned]] passive [[creature|mob]] in [[Minecraft]]. Having the ability to walk on [[lava]], Striders are very helpful for long distance travel in [[The Nether (minecraft)|]]. A player can ride it by putting a [[saddle]], and holding a warped fungus [[fishing rod|on a stick]] is required to control the Strider. 

Feeding two Striders with warped [[mushroom|fungi]] will breed them. Water and snow damages them.

title: n102_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Also goes by the nickname, Anne.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]]. She wears a [[grey jacket|grey]] & [[black jacket|black]] [[two-tone jacket]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts|bike]] [[short shorts]], a [[visor cap]] with [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[cat ears|cat]] [[animal ear headwear|ears]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[white socks]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]]. Usually depicted [[holding notebook|holding a notebook]].

She's a part of a Missilis lab project that wipes her memory on a daily basis, and they change her notebook to see if they can control her preferences.

As of Bond 5, she was rescued by the commander. However she is still recovering from memory loss.

h4. Official art

* !post #5988109: Default
* !post #5897870: [[N102 (miracle fairy) (nikke)|Miracle Fairy]].

title: snow_golem_(minecraft)
body:
Esentially a [[snowman]] in Minecraft. Players can summon it by placing two [[snow]] [[block (Minecraft)|]]s in I-shape and placing a carved [[pumpkin]] or [[jack-o'-lantern]]. Right-clicking a snow golem's head with [[shears]] will remove the pumpkin and reveal its true [[smiley face|face]]. 

It attacks mobs by throwing [[snowball]]s that inflict knockback, but deal zero damage except against [[Blaze (Minecraft)|]]s. It is immune to freezing damage from walking on powdered snow.

h4. See also
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

title: tachibana_marika
body:
One of the main characters in [[Nisekoi]] and a love interest of [[Ichijou Raku]]. Voiced by [[Asumi Kana]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange]]-[[brown hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|sidelocks]] that extend to thigh-level, bright [[brown eyes]] (can be [[red eyes|red]], [[medium breasts]], and a [[sunflower hair ornament]] on her right side. Her default outfit is a classic [[serafuku]] (white top with a [[black sailor collar]] plus a [[yellow neckerchief]] and a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]]), [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #1621960

body:

A [[BDSM]]-themed costume complemented with [[demon]]ic physical traits.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6627125

title: mutio
body:
Character from [[Ao No Roku-gou]].

Mutio, like the rest of her kind - "The Army of Chiron" - is a human-fish hybrid created by the scientist Dr. Zorndyke.
 
Though all members of her species share the same physical traits, she has red eyes and red spots that physically distinguish her from the others of her kind, making her unique.

She was exiled by the rest of her species for peacefully interacting with [[Hayami Tetsu]] - a human opposing Dr. Zorndyke - when they were tasked with carrying out his will, which is to destroy humanity.

title: tsukishima_hajime
body:
A [[Golden Kamuy]] character. He is a Sergeant under [[Tsurumi Tokushirou]]'s command in the [[Imperial Japanese Army|7th Division]].

Tsukishima is a short but thickset [[muscular male|muscular man]], with [[black hair|dark hair]] shaved in a [[buzz cut]], [[black eyes|dark eyes]], and [[stubble]] on his chin. His most significant physical traits are the two lines under his eyes and a short flat nose. Just like the rest of the 7th Division soldiers, he uses [[Arisaka]] type 30 [[rifle]] as a primary weapon and wears the standard Japanese [[military uniform]] ([[blue jacket|blue]] [[collared jacket]], [[blue pants]] with [[gaiters]], and [[kepi]] [[military hat|hat]]) and a [[white coat|white]] [[hooded coat]] or [[hooded cape|cape]] over it. Tsukishima is a very serious man, known for being diligent and dependable.

In his childhood had a friend called [[Igogusa]].

h4. External links

* "Golden Kamuy Wiki: Hajime Tsukishima":https://goldenkamuy.fandom.com/wiki/Hajime_Tsukishima

Its intended purpose is for brewing water breathing potions and trading with fisherman [[villager (minecraft)|villagers]].

title: lessar
body:
A character in [[Toaru Majutsu No Index]].

A member of the British magic cabal New Light. She spends much of her time with [[Kamijou Touma]] trying to find ways to seduce him into joining New Light and working for the United Kingdom. Like the rest of her group, she is patriotic to her country, only wishing the best for it, enough for her to make an enemy out of it and harm people if it is necessary.

title: axolotl_(minecraft)
body:
Mobs introduced in [[Minecraft]] update 1.17. Can spawn in various colors, including pink, white, brown, yellow and blue.

The blue variant is notorious for its rarity, with a 1/1200 (0.083%) chance of spawning when breeding.

In July 2021, blue axolotls has became a trend of sort across [[Hololive]] [[virtual YouTuber]]s after [[Shirakami Fubuki]] had successfully bred one, influencing other members including [[Houshou Marine]], [[Amane Kanata]], [[Shishiro Botan]], [[Hoshimachi Suisei]] and [[Shiranui Flare]], as well as [[Holostars]]' [[Arurandeisu]].

h4. See also

* [[Upao (Amane Kanata)]] ([[Amane Kanata]]'s channel mascot, based on the creature from minecraft)

h4. External links
* "Minecraft Wiki: Axolotl":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Axolotl

title: uchida_shuu
body:
A [[voice actor]] and [[indie virtual YouTuber]] who debuted in 2016 as the voice of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]]. She is best known for her mastery of the English language due to being raised in Australia. Born May 24, 1996. 

For a collaboration with [[hirota (company)|Hirota]], she was drawn as [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]] to represent the [[tea]]-flavored "Uchida Chou" [[cream puff]] (post #3476363). This form is usually referred to as "Uchida", always romanized, and can be distinguished from the actual Warspite by her [[asymmetrical bangs]].

She is the creator of [[Bokukawauso]], a strange [[otter]]-like character.

As designed by [[Fujima Takuya]], her [[virtual YouTuber]] guise portrays her with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], and [[yellow eyes]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[white dress]], [[pink jacket]], single [[white socks|white sock]] on her right, and [[slippers]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6010709

h4. Characters voiced

* [[luka_(kotonoha_amrilato)|Luka]] ([[Kotonoha Amrilato]])
* [[Mia Taylor]] ([[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]])
* [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]], [[ark royal (kancolle)|Ark Royal]], [[gambier bay (kancolle)|Gambier Bay]], [[mikura (kancolle)|Mikura]], [[perth (kancolle)|Perth]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Nanase Nanami (Heaven Burns Red)|]] ([[Heaven Burns Red]])
* [[Sonetto (Reverse:1999)|]] ([[Reverse:1999]])

Males wear a [[red coat]] [[coat on shoulders|on their shoulders]], a [[black jacket]], [[black shirt]], [[black gloves]], a [[grey belt]] with a [[tassel]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

Females wear a [[puffy long sleeves|puffy long-sleeved]] [[red coat]] with a [[shoulder cutout]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], [[black gloves]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[white skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]].

title: red_prison_magic_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] of the magic school in the Crimson Demon Village attended by [[Megumin]] from [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|Konosuba]] and her classmates.  It appears prominently in the prequel spinoff [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!]].

It consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]] and a brown hem, a [[red_necktie|red]] and [[orange_necktie|orange]] [[diagonal-striped_necktie|diagonally-striped]] [[necktie]], a long [[black_cloak|black]] [[cloak]] with [[wide sleeves]], a [[red_cloak|red]] [[two-sided_fabric|lining]], and a wide yellow neckline that is usually worn [[off shoulder]], and clipped with a [[brooch]]. The legwear and footwear appear to be up to the student's discretion, but legwear is always black and footwear is always [[brown_footwear|brown]].

h4. External links

title: naoetsu_high_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] of the Naoetsu Private High School most of the main characters attend in the [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]].

h4. Personal variants

[tn]See the following characters for more details on their variants.[/tn]

* [[Araragi Koyomi]]: wears no shirt under his gakuran and white socks
* [[Senjougahara Hitagi]]: wears black thighhighs and black loafers, skirt rolled up into a miniskirt
* [[Hanekawa Tsubasa]]: wears black kneehighs and brown loafers, medium skirt
* [[Kanbaru Suruga]]: wears black ankle socks, skirt rolled up into a miniskirt over black bike shorts, and white and red high top sneakers
* [[Oshino Ougi]]:
** Female uniform: wears a black (rather than purple) necktie and skirt (rolled up into a miniskirt), long sleeves extending past her fingertips, black pantyhose, brown loafers, black gloves, and a black turtleneck undershirt
** Male uniform: wears a black turtleneck undershirt and black gloves
* [[Oikura Sodachi]]: wears black pantyhose and black loafers
* [[Higasa Seiu]]: wears black kneehighs and brown loafers


h4. See also

* [[List of Uniforms]]
* [[Nanahyakuichi Middle School Uniform]] - the school uniform worn by Sengoku Nadeko, and young Araragi Koyomi and Oikura Sodachi
* [[Tsuganoki Second Junior High School Uniform]] - the school uniform worn by Araragi Karen and Araragi Tsukihi

title: tsuganoki_second_junior_high_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] of the Tsuganoki Second Junior High School attended by [[Araragi Karen]] and [[Araragi Tsukihi]] in the [[Monogatari (series)|Monogatari series]].

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] with a blue collar and a [[blue_bow|blue]] [[bowtie]]. The bottom half is a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]] with a navy blue stripe along the hem.

h4. See also

* [[Naoetsu High School Uniform]] - the school uniform worn by most of the main cast
* [[Nanahyakuichi Middle School Uniform]] - the school uniform worn by Sengoku Nadeko, and young Araragi Koyomi and Oikura Sodachi
* [[List of Uniforms]]
other_names: 私立栂の木第二中学校制服

title: getsuyoubi_no_tawawa
body:
An immensely popular original fanservice (often if not always centered around breasts) image series created by [[Himura Kiseki]] on Twitter as "offerings to the corporate wageslaves heading in to work on Monday mornings". Began on February 22, 2015 with "this tweet":https://twitter.com/Strangestone/status/569617644472573952. For over a year, it lacked any substantial commentary to go along with the images; during 2016, it started to bear some semblance of continuity, and a few reoccurring characters were given simple names for the first time.

Received an online 12-episode anime adaptation consisting of short five minute episodes starting on October 9, 2016, localized in English as [i]Tawawa on Monday[/i]. The series was given its own ending song by [[Ai-chan (tawawa)|]]'s voice actress [[Harada Sayaka]], but not an opening song.

The image series is also notable for distinctive [[blue theme|blue]] [[monochrome]] coloration.

h4. Characters

title: adaptive_combat_rifle
body:
The Bushmaster [b]ACR[/b] (Adaptive Combat Rifle), formerly known as the Magpul Masada, is an American [[assault rifle]] designed by [[Magpul]] Industries and manufactured by Bushmaster Firearms International and [[Remington Arms]]. Remington produces the selective fire version for [[military]] and [[police|law enforcement]] use while Bushmaster makes the semi-automatic only version.

It bears a resemblance to the [[FN SCAR]], and borrows features from other [[rifle]]s such as the [[AR-15]] and [[H&K G36]]. This weapon can switch between using 5.56×45mm NATO, and 7.62×39mm [[ammunition]] by simply replacing the barrel, bolt, and [[magazine (weapon)|]].

h4. See also
* [[ACR (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Adaptive Combat Rifle":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptive_Combat_Rifle

body: The Anzio 20mm rifle is an American [[anti-materiel rifle]] designed and marketed by Anzio Iron Works. Features include an optional three-round detachable box magazine, a 49-inch (1.2 m) barrel, and threaded muzzle to accept either a [[muzzle device]] or [[suppressor]].

title: feater_(arknights)
body:
[i]FEater, Specialist Operator of Rhodes Island, will settle disputes with her excellent martial art skills.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Yen[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 10[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]160 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]11 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A famous action movie star from Yen, FEater was forced to give up her film career after contracting Oripathy. She found a new purpose in life at Rhodes Island.

She is of the Ursus race, which shares traits with bears. Her Chinese name literally means "iron-eating beast" and is a literary and historical name for the [[panda|giant panda]]. FEater is a calque of this, as well as a pun incorporating the chemical abbreviation for iron, [i]Fe[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Sonozaki Mie]].

h4. Skins

title: tokisaki_kurumi
body:
A character from [[Date A Live]]. She is voiced by [[Sanada Asami]].

Kurumi is one of the spirits appearing in our world from another realm. Unlike most spirits who are shy and/or bashful, she is openly easy going and very pro-active towards sex. However, she is also vicious and brutal. Her powers revolve around time and control of shadows, with which she can absorb her enemies.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2676029

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and possesses [[heterochromia]], with one [[red eyes|red eye]] and one [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[clock eyes|clock eye]].

She wears a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[red dress|red]]/[[orange dress|orange]] [[lolita fashion|lolita dress]], along with a [[lolita hairband]], [[frilled choker|frilled]] [[black choker]], [[detached sleeves]], [[red ribbon]]s, [[thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She also has [[uneven twintails]] and wields two [[flintlock]] pistols of differing length.

When not in her Astral Dress, she can be seen with [[low twintails]] and [[hair over one eye|hair covering her left eye]]. She also wears the [[Raizen High School uniform]] when attending said school.

h4. External links

* "Date A Live Wiki: Kurumi Tokisaki":[https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Kurumi_Tokisaki]

title: eren_crying_(meme)
body:
References to a scene at the end of [[Shingeki no Kyojin]].

Spoilers:
<spoiler>After [[Eren Yeager]] spent the previous few chapters cruelly and nonchalantly destroying his personal relationships with his childhood friends, including his love interest [[Mikasa Ackerman]], he finally reveals that it was all a ruse to accomplish his goals. He breaks down in tears and further reveals that he doesn't want Mikasa to move on or forget about him after his impending death, desperately saying "I want her to remember me for life, at least for 10 years after I die!" This quote is the Japanese name for this meme. </spoiler>

Reference: asset #22539776 (spoiler alert)

title: yonic_symbol
body:
The female equivalent to the [[phallic symbol]]: innocuous objects or gestures that reference the [[pussy|female genitalia]]. 

h4. Common Yonic Symbols
* Fruits with plenty of spillable seeds or lots of juices, such as [[pomegranate]]s, [[apple]]s, or [[peach]]es  
* Small lollipops (like "dum-dums":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dum_Dums_(lollipop)]) or small fruits like [[grapes]]  and [[cherry|cherries]], evoking a [[clitoris]]
* Pastries with "lava"-style filling, anything with free flowing liquid that can evoke [[pussy juice]] 
* [[Syrup]] or [[honey]], often shown dripping from the ceiling or onto fingers
* Objects that have a perforated opening and can be pulled open from the sides (such as [[clam]]s) tend to evoke a [[spread pussy]]
* [[Flower]]s, especially [[lily (flower)|lillies]], due to their association with femininity and their reproductive habits (and since "[[yuri]]" is the Japanese word for "lilly")

h4. See also
* [[sexually suggestive]]
* [[simulated cunnilingus]]
* [[simulated fingering]]
* [[symbolism]]

title: rosa_(arknights)
body:
[i]Rosa, a member of the Ursus Student Self-Government Group, is ready to welcome a new life.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Natalya Andreyevna Rostova

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 31[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]174 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An Ursine aristocrat who served as a middle school student council president prior to the Chernobog incident, she along with the other members of the Ursus Student Self-Governing Group were rescued by Rhodes Island. She was initially assigned to the Logistics department before transferring to the frontlines as a sniper. Her weapon of choice is a harpoon cannon.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Children of Ursus[/i].

Her motif is based on [[polar bear]]s. Her callsign "Роса" is Russian for [i]dew[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Ueda Reina]].

h4. Skins
* !post #3960586: Default
* !post #3960588: Elite II
* !post #4884297: [[Rosa (Masterpiece) (Arknights)|Masterpiece]]

A founder and member of Ursus Student Self-Governing Group along with [[Zima_(Arknights)|Zima]] and [[Gummy_(Arknights)|Gummy]]. She and her group took refuge at Rhodes Island during the fall of Chernobog at the end of Episode One. A cool-headed and rational, though somewhat introverted bookworm. She also provides intel and data processing services for Rhodes Island. She attacks by firing magic missiles from her book.

One of the protagonists of the side story event [i]Children of Ursus[/i].

Her motif is based on spectacled bears. Her callsign "Истина" means [i]"Truth"[/i], or [i]"True"[/i] in Russian.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Yuuki Aoi]].

title: m134_minigun
body:
The [b]M134 Minigun[/b] is a 7.62 mm, six-barreled [[machine gun]] with a high rate of fire (2,000 to 6,000 rounds per minute), employing [[gatling gun|Gatling-style]] rotating barrels with an external power source (thus it also qualifies as a "chaingun", although in the US that term is a registered trademark for another type of externally powered machine gun).

Certain defining characteristic of the M134 includes a handle bar just above the rotary gun barrel, a cylindical belt feeding mechanism on either side of the gun, and a "stick handle" at the rear end with a firing button on top of it.

The term "[[Minigun]]" has popularly come to refer to any externally powered Gatling gun of rifle caliber, though the term is sometimes used to refer to guns of similar rates of fire and configuration, regardless of power source and caliber.

This tag is used for any image that depicts the specific M134 model. For other generic hand-held gatling guns, see [[minigun]].

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M134 Minigun":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minigun

title: vermillion_masquerade
body:
The main antagonist of the first arc in the [[kamen_america_(comic)|Kamen America]] comic series. Vermillion Masquerade was struck by the same space probe as [[kamen_america|Kamen America]], [[kamen_comet|Kamen Comet]], and [[kamen_ramen|Kamen Ramen]], giving her the ability to control earth and rocks. She uses her ability to create the monsters the Kamen Corps fight in the first arc.

[spoiler]Her true identity is [[kamen_america|Carly's]] childhood friend, Victoria "Vicki" Kaminski.[/spoiler]

title: kamen_ramen
body:
A supporting character in the [[kamen america (comic)|Kamen America]] comic series and the third member of the Kamen Corps. Her real name is Kimiko Kaneko. She is a young, Japanese woman and the heiress of a massive instant ramen company. She sought out [[kamen america|Carly]] seeing her as a role model to help her learn to balance her obligations with her passions. She was also struck by the same debris as Carly and [[kamen comet|Misha]], giving her control over the flow and temperature of water while in her transformed state. Kimiko wants to be a radiologist but is unable to pass the college entrance exam despite having taken it 78 times.

Kimiko has [[brown eyes]] long [[black hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with [[chopsticks]]. Her hair turns [[blue hair|blue]] when transformed.

title: digimon:_the_movie
body:
[b]Digimon: The Movie[/b] is 2000 compilation movie produced by 20th Century Fox for their Fox Kids division. It amalgates [[Digimon Adventure (1999 film)]], [[Digimon Adventure: Bokura no War Game]], and around 20% of [[Digimon Adventure 02: Digimon Hurricane Jouriku!! Chouzetsu Shinka!! Ougon no Digimental]], with all of the music being replaced with a new score from composers Udi Harpaz and Amotz Plessner. There are also, more notably, musical stings from popular bands at the time, like Smash Mouth and Barenaked Ladies.

The film was created as an attempt to cash in on the success of Pokémon the First Movie in the United States and elsewhere in the western world.

title: splatoonification
body:
A type of [[alternate species]] where a pre-existing character is turned into an [[Inkling]] or [[Octoling]] from [[Splatoon_(series)|Splatoon]]. This includes changing their hair into [[tentacle hair]], and giving them [[fangs]] and [[pointy ears]].

Do not use if a character is solely [[cosplay|cosplaying]] as a Splatoon character.

Use [[animalization]] instead if drawing them as a [[squid]], [[octopus]] or [[jellyfish]] etc.

body:

As the dance act involves 3 of the characters going down a slide regardless of whether it'd be in character for them to do so otherwise, the slide has been infamously nicknamed "[b]The Slide of Destroying Dignity[/b] (尊厳破壊滑り台)" by fans.

title: eiffel_tower
body:
A wrought iron [[tower]] built in [[Paris]] by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World's Fair. It is a globally recognized cultural icon of [[France]] and the tallest structure in the French capital, standing 320 m (1,050 ft) high above the green expanse of the "Champ de Mars":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Champ_de_Mars. The bronze-painted tower has two observation decks and restaurants in addition to the top floor, including a champagne bar and a reconstruction of Eiffel's office.

h4. See also

* [[Tokyo Skytree]]
* [[Tokyo Tower]]
* [[Tour Metallique de Fourviere]]
* [[Tag group:Real world locations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Eiffel Tower":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eiffel_Tower

title: alien_vs._predator
body:
[b]Aliens vs Predator[/b], also known as [b]Alien VS Predator[/b], [b]Aliens Versus Predator[/b] or [b]AVP[/b], is a franchise that mixes both the [[alien (1979)|Alien]] and [[predator (1987)|Predator]] [[Science fiction]] horror and action series.

It started as an American crossover comic book series published by the Dark Horse Comics company from 1989 to 1990. There have been also 2 official film adaptations (released in 2004 and 2007), many books, graphic novels, other comics and several [[video game]]s based on the AVP universe. 

One of the first and most famous video game of the series was created by [[Capcom]] in 1994 and was a beat-'em-up cooperative action game. Later games have been first person shooters. 

h4. See also

* [[Aliens (1986)|]]
* [[Xenomorph]]
* [[Predator (character)|]]
* [[Noguchi Machiko]] - The original heroine from the first AVP series.
* [[Dutch Schaefer]]
* [[Linn Kurosawa]]

h4. External links

title: yatate
body:
A Japanese writing set with a carrying box. It was designed for portability and convenience.

The first yatate were long boxes, with the ink compartment in the axis of the pen; later on, the 'smoking pipe' design became popular.

The yatate can also be equipped with a chain, enabling it to be latched onto an [[obijime]] as a type of [[netsuke]] (obijime accessory).

* [https://newpentrace.net/east/yatate/index.html](Newpentrance.net: Yatate)

title: sea_bunny
body:
Any kind of [[sea slug]] that vaguely looks like a [[rabbit]]. 

There is a species of sea slug, the jorunna parva, which has the nickname of [i]sea bunny[/i] in several languages. The official Japanese name for it however is [i]sesame velvet sea slug[/i], due to its small spots and soft appearance. As a result, it is sometimes given the nickname goma-chan (sesame-chan).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Jorunna Parva (Sea bunny)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jorunna_parva]

title: fai_chun
body:
[i]Fai chun[/i] is a traditional decoration that is frequently used during [[Chinese New Year]]. People put fai chun in the doorways to create a festive atmosphere. Sometimes written on this decoration is a symbol of [[good fortune symbol|good fortune (福)]], which is also sometimes depicted [[dao_fu|upside-down]].

Customarily, fai chun is written by hand, but owing to convenience, printed versions are mass-produced nowadays. Fai chun is in either square or rectangular shape. It can be hung vertically or horizontally. Not only does it exist in China but also in Korea, Japan, and Vietnam. 

h4. Subtypes

* !post #2765835: [[Antithetical couplet]] (Spring couplets / Chunlian)
* !post #3425908: [[Doufang]] 
* !post #6004036: [[Chuntiao]] (2 to 4 characters)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fai chun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fai_chun

title: serpent_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], her name is read as 'Nacha' / 'Na Qia' in-game by the Japanese/Chinese dub, but localised as 'Serpent'. Voiced by [[Sakura Kaoru (voice actor)|]].

An S class Sinner, an [[acrobatics]] performer of the Phantom Entertainment, her body developed snake-like features such as [[pointy ears]], [[slit pupils]], [[forked tongue]] and [[scales]] on her shoulder and legs. She owns a [[giant snake]] as a pet and uses a hollow [[ball and chain|ball chained]] to a [[kama (weapon)|]] as her weapon. Her alignment is Love.

Serpent has [[grey eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair|blue]]/[[aqua hair]] in the style of [[low twintails]] ([[low-tied long hair]]) tied together with two [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]s, typically depicted with [[hair over one eye]]. Wears a [[black hat|black]] and [[white hat|white]] [[two-tone hat|two tone]] [[party hat]], two black hair bows and one [[white bow|white hair bow]], and a pair of [[Star earrings]] on her eare.

She wears a [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[two-tone dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] and [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts under dress]], the dress itself has long [[crinoline]]. Wears [[mismatched legwear]], right leg has a [[white thighhighs|white]] [[argyle thighhighs|argyle]] [[single thighhigh]] while the left leg wears a [[vertical-striped socks|vertical-striped]] [[single kneehigh]], she wears a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[pointy footwear|pointy shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20131691: Mugshot
* !asset #20131693: Default
* !asset #20131694: Phase 3

body:

Eirene Campbell, an S rank Sinner, the CEO and president of the Quinn Corporation<spoiler>, and secretly the head of the Campbell family</spoiler>. A skilled [[chess]] player, usually depicted [[playing chess]] or with [[chess piece]]s. Her alignment is Greed.

Eirene has [[blue eyes|blue]] (right) / [[pink eyes|pink]] (left) [[heterochromia]] eyes, and has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored tips|tips]], hair style has [[half updo]] and [[parted bangs]] elements. Wears [[ear piercing]]s and a metallic [[headpiece]] around her head.

Body attire includes a [[red cape|red]] [[two-sided cape]], a [[long dress|long]] [[red dress|red]] [[halter dress]] with [[side slit]], [[single elbow glove|single]] [[black gloves|black]] elbow glove, and [[thighhighs]] with [[butterfly print]], [[vertical-striped thighhighs|vertical stripes]] and [[legwear garter|garter suspenders]] visible.

title: hecate_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], one of the two starter characters given to the [[Chief (path to nowhere)|]] (player) in-game and a frequent character in the canon story team. Voiced by [[Hanamori Yumiri]].

An almost [[expressionless]] and emotionless girl, Hecate follows the Chief's order with absolute obedience, the [[spirit]] monster she summons is called [[Nightmare (path to nowhere)|]]. Her alignment is Limbo.

Hecate has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[blue hair]] and [[grey eyes]], her left eye is typically [[one eye covered|covered]] by an [[eyepatch]], when revealed it has a blue [[glowing eye|glow]]. She has [[black bandages]] or wrappings on her body, around the [[bandaged neck|neck]], [[bandaged arm|arm]] and [[bandaged leg|leg]] regions. Has [[multiple scars]] on her [[scar on arm|arms]].

She wears a [[white robe]] as her only piece of clothing, the robe sleeves has restraining straps similar to a [[straitjacket]]. Wears a pair of [[brown footwear|brown]] / [[leather boots|leather]] [[knee boots]] for footwear. Usually seen carrying a large [[notebook]] and a [[pen]] for drawing purposes.

title: luvia_ray_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by Noguchi Ruriko.

A Sinner with dissociative identity disorder, the gentle Luvia and the cautious Ray, Luvia wishes to have a glamourous career in acting, while Ray simply wishes Luvia to be safe. Her alignment is Limbo.

Luvia Ray has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair]] in a [[twin braids]] style, the right side (Luvia) is [[pink hair|pink]] and the left side (Ray) is [[purple hair|purple]], her [[heterochromia]] eyes ([[pink eyes|pink]] and [[purple eyes|purple]]) are also on the respective sides. 

Luvia Ray wears a [[short dress|short]] [[red dress|red]] [[pencil dress]], the dress itself has [[collared dress|collars]] and is of a [[halter dress|halterneck design]]. A [[two-tone cardigan]] (Right side is [[white cardigan|white]] while the left side is [[black cardigan|black]]), typically in an [[off shoulder]] fashion. Wears [[white thighhighs|white]] [[fishnet thighhighs]] for her lower body.

title: labyrinth_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by [[Yasuno Kiyono]].

AI Maid III Labyrinth, a B rank Sinner with extensive [[prosthesis]], no memories of her past, an obedient, hardworking and very efficient [[maid]]. Her alignment is Anger.

Labyrinth has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]] and a [[mole on cheek|mole on her right cheek]], wears a [[maid headdress]] with her product tag ([[price tag]]) still attached, and has a pair of [[mechanical ears]] ([[fake animal ears]]/[[cat ears]]). All four of her limbs are prosthesis, [[seams]] and [[robot joints]] can be seen on her limbs, her feet are [[running blades]].

Her attire is a typical maid attire with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[see-through sleeves]], though a large [[waist bow]] is in front of her [[maid apron|apron]]. Her [[bowtie]] has a power button [[switch]]. Uses [[dagger]]s in combat.

title: hella_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], one of the two starter characters given to the [[Chief (path to nowhere)|]] (player) in-game and a frequent character in the canon story team. Voice by [[Koga Aoi]].

A B-rank Sinner, she is a [[petite]] girl from Syndicate who acts cute, but can also turn extremely violent when she does not get her way. Her alignment is Violence.

Hella has [[long hair|long]] lavender [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], is always seen wearing a [[white headwear|white]] [[pom pom beanie]] with a bear [[sleep mask]] attached to the front and two [[safety pin]]s clipped on the side. She also wears a [[black mask|black]] [[mouth mask]] on her chin.

Her clothing consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[halter dress]] (cleavage area held together by a safety pin), a [[grey jacket]] with [[button badge]]s clipped on that is typically worn [[off shoulder]] and left [[open jacket|open]], a pair of [[grey gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[mary janes]] with [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]]. The lower section of her skirt is slightly [[dirty clothes|dirty]] and [[torn clothes|torn]].

Uses a water pipe ([[Industrial pipe]]) as club weapon.

title: stargazer_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by Noguchi Ruriko.

An S rank Sinner, a travelling fortune teller of the White Sands, otherwise known by her real name <spoiler>Anarkia</spoiler>. Her alignment is Heresy.

Stargazer has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], her eyes are canonically violet purple, but can either be depicted as [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[purple eyes|purple]] by artists. She has [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]], her hair is [[parted hair|parted]] into two halves, each tied by a [[hair belt]]. Has gold [[body markings]] on her stomach, waist and thighs.

She wears a [[open jacket|open]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[white jacket]] with [[winged headwear|wings ornament]] on the hood, a [[green tube top]], [[white pants|white]] [[baggy pants]] with [[hip vent]]s and [[knee cutout]]s, and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[toeless footwear|toeless]] shoes.

title: nox_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voiced by [[Koshimizu Ami]].

An S rank Sinner, NOX is tall and slim, almost monochrome in character colouration, NOX's body once belonged to a girl name <spoiler>[[Amber (path to nowhere)|]], who was bed ridden due to a rare disease</spoiler>. Her alignment is Limbo.

Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] and [[pale skin]], her eyes are [[blank eyes|blank]] (sometimes depicted by artists as [[empty eyes|empty]] [[white eyes]]), her arms below her biceps are mutated, has [[cracked skin|cracked]] and [[black hands]] ([[colored extremities]]), two [[hole on body|holes]] where her elbow joints are, and several metal spikes [[impaled|impales]] her wrists.

Her only piece of clothing is a [[long dress|long]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] and [[hooded dress|hooded]] [[black dress]], the dress also has a [[turtleneck dress|turtleneck]] [[high collar]], the dress skirt has [[side slit]]s on both sides and are [[torn dress|torned]]. Usually depicted with her [[hood up]], uses a [[polearm]] ([[lance]]/[[spear]]) in combat.

title: eve_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]]. Voice by [[Fujii Yukiyo]]

An S rank Sinner, Eve is [[pale skin|pale]] girl bound to a [[wheelchair]] with the ability to both [[animate object|animate]] [[toy]]s and turn people into toys ([[character doll]]s). Her alignment is Love.

Eve is almost doll like in appearance herself, her outfit and character colouration is almost [[monochrome]]. Eve has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] and [[grey eyes]], has a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]] and [[bags under eyes]] due to sleep deprivation. The only part of her [[prosthetic leg]]s visible are the [[doll joints]] of her ankle. Wears a [[single earring|single]] [[blue gemstone]] earring.

Eve wears a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]], [[frilled collar]], a [[cleavage cutout]] and a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]]. title: shalom_(path_to_nowhere)
body:
A playable character from [[Path to Nowhere]], and a central story character from chapter 12 onwards. Voiced by [[Saitou Chiwa]].

An S rank Sinner, also known as Hush-X of Paradeisos, usually seen with her floating weapon [[Schorl (path to nowhere)|]], and usually seen [[smile|smiling]]. Her alignment is Sloth.

Shalom has [[long hair|long]] [[gradient hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] roots to [[white hair|white]] tips, she has [[purple eyes]], her right eye can [[glowing eye|glow]] and display a [[triangle-shaped pupils|triangle-shaped pupil]] ([[mismatched pupils]]) when she uses her ability.

Her outfits include a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long skirt|long]] [[grey skirt|grey]] [[hobble skirt]], and a [[black coat]] typically seen on her [[coat on shoulders|shoulders]].
