title: soga_no_tojiko
body:
The "Departed Spirit of the Children of the Gods".

Stage 5 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]].

She is a very practical woman who can use coarse language. She also appears to be a foil to Futo's air-headed, jovial nature. In spite of the language she uses, she's actually kind, though short-tempered. Her friendship/rivalry with [[Mononobe no Futo]] led her to be unable to reincarnate like Futo and [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]]. Soga instead came back as a [[ghost]], with two [[ghost tail]]s in the place of legs. Exactly where her body transitions from human-like to ghost-like is unclear, due to the long dress that she wears.

Her name came from "Tojiko no Iratsume":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/刀自古郎女], a daughter of [[Soga no Umako]] and consort of [[Shoutoku Taishi]]. Since her name comes from the consort of the character on whom [[Toyosatomimi no Miko]] was based, the two are often depicted by fans as a [[couple]].

h4. See also

* [[Yatteyan'yo]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Soga no Tojiko":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Soga_no_Tojiko

title: tasukete_eirin
body:
[code]
_, ,_ ∩
( ﾟ∀ﾟ)彡 えーりん！えーりん！
⊂彡
[/code]

Translates to "Help me, Eirin!"

A [[meme]] related to [[Houraisan Kaguya]] of [[Touhou]] with her calling out "Tasukete Eirin!" and making the hand gesture. The gesture doesn't have the same meaning as in the [[oppai oppai]] meme. Kaguya always relies on the help of her bodyguard, [[Yagokoro Eirin]], on many occasions. Also somewhat associated with jokes about Kaguya's [[NEET]] lifestyle. Based at least partially on the common opinion that Eirin is a more difficult boss than Kaguya in [[Imperishable Night]]. Originated from a song by the same name by COOL&CREATE.

h4.See also

* [[oppai oppai]]

title: yagokoro_eirin
body:
The "Brain of the Moon". Secondary final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]].

Lunarian pharmaceutical genius responsible for creating the Hourai Elixir that gave her good friend [[Houraisan Kaguya]] - and later Kaguya's bitter nemesis, [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] - immortality. She has since been Kaguya's bodyguard and caretaker in their mansion, Eientei. She is also the mentor of Kaguya's pet lunar rabbit, [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]], and by extension Reisen's charge, earth-born rabbit youkai [[Inaba Tewi]]. Owing to her expertise, she became [[Gensokyo]]'s chief pharmacist.

Due to her estimated age (well over 1000 years old and possibly one of the original Lunarians) and her relatively mature demeanor (compared to her charge), she is often included in the "Old Maids Alliance" with [[Yakumo Yukari]] and [[Yasaka Kanako]].

Most famous for the fans' rallying cry "Eirin! Eirin! [[Tasukete Eirin]]!" which, in fact, originated from Houraisan Kaguya.

On her hat is typically the [[red cross]] symbol. At the bottom of her dress are [[trigram|trigrams]] composing the [[bagua]]. She is frequently depicted with [[constellation|constellations]] sewn into her dress.

Her surname invokes the name of the Shinto god of intellect and wisdom, Yagokoro-no-Omoikane. This, combined with ZUN's comment about her being in "the higher order of gods", gave rise to the belief that she may in fact be Omoikane.

h4. See also

* "[[Yagokoro]]", a horribly failed attempt to draw her on Shift_JIS

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Eirin Yagokoro":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Eirin_Yagokoro

title: kamishirasawa_keine
body:
"The History Eater"

Stage 3 mid-boss and boss as well as Extra Stage mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]].

A were-hakutaku and schoolteacher with the ability to consume the history of [[Gensokyo]]'s Human Village to protect it from malicious youkai. Normally she has bluish-white hair and matching blue dress, except during a full moon when her hair becomes greenish-white, her dress turns green, and she grows horns. In this form, she can create and alter history.

Doujin works portray her as a [[teacher]] for some of the "child" characters in the series by whom she is feared for her punishment - a headbutt. She is also seen tutoring to [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] with predictable results. In canon, however, while she is a schoolteacher, she refuses to teach youkai. She is also a good friend to [[Fujiwara no Mokou]]. Many fans often pair her with [[Morichika Rinnosuke]] either as a childhood friend or a colleague due to their similar status as half-youkai.

h4. See also

* [[Ex-Keine]], a nickname given to her alternate form
* [[Kamishirasawa Keine (hakutaku)]]
* [[Sukusuku Hakutaku]], a cute creature form of [[Ex-Keine]]
* [[caved (touhou)|]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bai Ze":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bai_Ze
* "Touhou Wiki: Keine Kamishirasawa":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Keine_Kamishirasawa

title: komeiji_koishi
body:
The "Closed Eyes of Love". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Subterranean Animism]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend In Limbo]], and [[Antinomy Of Common Flowers]]

A "Satori":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satori_%28folklore%29 [[traditional youkai|youkai]]. Koishi has sealed off her mind-reading ability (represented by the fact her third eye is closed) so she would not experience the fear and loathing her older [[sisters|sister]] [[Komeiji_Satori|Satori]] suffered.  This indirectly gave her a new power, the ability to manipulate the [i]subconscious[/i]. Her own conscious mind was sealed away as well, and she no longer has a real personality or desires. Koishi now wanders [[Gensokyo]], going wherever her subconscious wills her.

h4. Related Pools

* pool #2453: Touhou - The Open Eyes of Love.
* pool #21469: Touhou - God Damn It Koishi!

h4. See also 

* [[Koishi Day]] (14th May and 14th June)
* [[Koishi Komeiji's Heart-Throbbing Adventure]], a notorious fan work featuring her

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Koishi Komeiji":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Koishi_Komeiji

title: toramaru_shou
body:
The "Disciple of Bishamonten".

Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A [[tiger]] youkai with the ability to attract treasures and disciple to [[Bishamonten]] ("Vaiśravaṇa" in Indian), guardian god of the north. Together with her allies [[Murasa Minamitsu]] and [[Kumoi Ichirin]], she sought to free their master [[Hijiri Byakuren]] from her "prison" in Makai. She also has her own underling, a [[mouse (animal)|]] youkai named [[Nazrin]].

h4. See also

* [[Toramaru Shou (Tiger)]]
* Pool #11329 - Shou's Missing Pagoda - Wanted by [[Nazrin]] or Shou, usually found in unusual places.
* "Nyan Clan of Gensokyo":/pools/17046

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Shou Toramaru":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Shou_Toramaru

A [[Touhou]] character about whom very little is known. Her sole appearance in the series was in the second chapter of [[Curiosities of Lotus Asia]].

title: yakumo_ran
body:
The "Nine-Tailed Strategist". Extra Stage boss and Phantasm stage midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

[[Yakumo Yukari]]'s 800+-year-old [[kyuubi]] [[kitsune]] shikigami who specializes in black magic. She is also powerful enough to have her own shikigami, a [[nekomata]] named [[Chen]], to whom she is portrayed to act motherly towards prominently in fanworks.

In volume two of [[Strange Creators of Outer World]], it has been revealed that Ran is actually a shikigami parasitically taking host of a nine-tailed fox youkai so strongly that the host's personality never shows on the surface; leading people to not have any difficulty seeing her as a kitsune. However, this seemed to be subtlely hinted at in Yukari's [[Bohemian Archive in Japanese Red]] article where Yukari constantly repeats to [[shameimaru aya|Aya]] that Ran is a shikigami and not an animal.

In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], Ran (or maybe just her host body) is revealed to have once been an inhabitant of the Animal Realm, and to have been friends with [[Toutetsu Yuuma]].

Ran has been described to have a gentle personality and to share her host's species-wide love of [[aburaage|fried tofu]]. She excels at mathematics and is able to solve nigh impossible equations instantly; simply seeing it as a hobby to kill time. She is rather robotic in nature when it comes to following Yukari's orders whereas Ran herself describes them as "Yukari's programming". Due to her master's prominent sleeping habits, Ran is usually doing her bidding at a constant. However, Yukari herself has stated that she would like to see Ran do something other than simply follow her orders.

Ran is simply seen as a tool that's loved in Yukari's eyes. If she is to ever stray away from her duties as a shikigami or to forget that she is one, she is to be violently disciplined, such as being beaten on the head by her parasol.

She is notorious in many fanworks as a streaker, earning her the nickname "Suppa Tenko":/pools/1733 ("Naked Heavenly Fox"), and for bursting into an [[excessive nosebleed]] if Chen does anything exceptionally cute.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Ran Yakumo":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Ran_Yakumo

title: cunt_punt
body:
When the female character's crotch area is being hit by something, such as a [[crotch kick]].

Contrary to the belief common among males, it is indeed quite painful for a woman to get kicked down there, mainly due to all the nerve endings that are concentrated in that area.

It can be a form of erotic play described as [[Cunt busting]].

title: minagawa_takurou
body: [[Di Gi Charat]] character. A young man who regularly visits Gamers and has a crush on [[Usada Hikaru|Usada]]. He loves [[melon bread]].

title: mike_(di_gi_charat)
body:
[[Di Gi Charat]] character first introduced in [[Panyo Panyo Di Gi Charat]]. She is a childhood friend of [[Dejiko]]'s and is a tomboy who enjoys fishing.

She has short [[red hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

title: yasaka_kanako
body:
The "Avatar of Mountains and Lakes".

Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Mountain of Faith]], and later made playable in [[Sunken Fossil World]]. In canon appearance, she has short purple hair, wears a mirror on her chest, has a circular [[shimenawa]] floating behind her back. Her weapon is the [[onbashira]].

She is the goddess of the Moriya Shrine after defeating [[Moriya Suwako]] a long time ago, her symbol is a snake as signified by the [[shimenawa]], which she adopted to symbolize her victory over the frog-themed goddess Suwako. Some artists take the snake symbolism much further, such as depicting Kanako with [[slit pupils]] (as in the [[aged down]] [[snake-eyed Kanako]]), a [[long tongue|long]] and/or [[forked tongue]], and even as a [[lamia]]. Her true power is dominion over wind and rain. Due to her estimated age and imposing appearance, she is jokingly a member of the "Old Maids Alliance":/pools/1053.

h4. See also

* [[Moriya Suwako]] - fellow goddess of the Moriya Shrine
* [[Kochiya Sanae]] - shrine maiden of the Moriya Shrine
* [[Reiuji Utsuho]] - the hell raven who she had given godly power to
* [[snake-eyed Kanako]] - A generally young version of Kanako with snake-eyes.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Kanako Yasaka":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kanako_Yasaka

title: onozuka_komachi
body:
The "Sanzu Ferryman", penultimate boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] and later a recurring playable character.

A shinigami with the ability to manipulate distance. She ferries the souls of the dead across the Sanzu River to be judged by her boss, [[Shiki Eiki]]. However, she is also notorious for being a carefree slacker who works at her own pace, much to the irritation of her employer, who sometimes beats her up with the [[Rod of Remorse]]. Mostly depicted with a rather [[large breasts|large bust]], which sometimes angers her superior, who is usually depicted with a [[flat chest]].

Because of her connection with the Sanzu River, she may appear along with [[spider lily|spider lilies]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Komachi Onozuka":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Komachi_Onozuka

title: murasa_minamitsu
body:
The "Ghost of the Shipwreck". 

Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] and playable character in [[Sunken Fossil World]]. 

Captain Murasa is the [[ghost]] of a drowned girl who earned notoriety for her ability to capsize ships, until she was adopted by [[Hijiri Byakuren]] who appointed her as captain of her [[palanquin ship|ship]]. After Byakuren was sealed, Murasa and her fellow disciples [[Toramaru Shou]] and [[Kumoi Ichirin]] moved in to save her using the same ship she entrusted to them. Usually seen holding a [[hishaku]].

She has been memetically referred to as Captain Murasa.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Minamitsu Murasa":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Minamitsu_Murasa

title: usami_renko
body:
A [[Touhou]] character.

A friend of [[Maribel Hearn]] who lives in the outside world.

Has the ability to tell location and time by looking at the sky.

Her connections to [[Usami Sumireko]] are currently unknown, but their identical surnames indicate a familial tie.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Usami Renko":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Renko_Usami

title: wakasagihime
body:
The "Mermaid Living In Fresh Water."  Stage 1 boss of [[Touhou]] 14, [[Double Dealing Character]]. 

A timid [[mermaid]] who lives in the [[Misty Lake]].

She along with [[Imaizumi Kagerou]] and [[Sekibanki]] are part of the [[grass root youkai network]].

She has visible breasts in her official art which has caused many artists to exaggerate their size in fanart.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Wakasagihime":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Wakasagihime

title: rinna_(di_gi_charat)
body:
[[Di Gi Charat]] character first introduced in [[Panyo Panyo Di Gi Charat]]. She is a childhood friend of [[Dejiko]] and owns a bakery. She is also narcoleptic and frequently falls asleep at inappropriate times.

She has [[blue hair]] and [[brown eyes]], and is usually seen wearing a [[purple dress]].

title: mononobe_no_futo
body:
"[i]Shikaisen[/i] from Ancient Japan".

Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Ten Desires]], and later a playable character in [[Hopeless Masquerade]].

A [i]shikaisen[/i] who essentially abandoned her body into an object. She is able to take on many forms, but prefers her more old-fashioned look, wearing something close to a [[kariginu]], with the addition of a purple [[skirt]] and a [[tate eboshi]].

Appears to have developed a competitive rivalry and friendship with [[Kumoi Ichirin]] as a result of their partnership in [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

h4. See also

* Pool #16206 - Futo the Pyromaniac - Futo intentionally burning things for fun.

title: son_biten
body: The Great Sage of Small Sanctuaries First appeared in [[Touhou]] 19: [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] as a boss and playable character. Hyped up as the reincarnation of the Monkey King, [[Sun Wukong]] by herself and [[Kicchou Yachie]], Biten is a Sarugami who works for the Kiketsu Family as part of their operations to take over the surface world. In reality, as with [[Mitsugashira Enoko]] and [[Tenkajin Chiyari]], she is a spy whose true allegiance lies with [[Nippaku Zanmu]]. She was tasked with sabotaging the Kiketsu Family's invasion plans from within by playing them for time as part of Zanmu's gambit to prevent a surface war. At the end, she decides to stay with the Kiketsu Family for real after feeling sorry for Yachie. h4. See also * [[Son Biten (Monkey)]] h4. External Links * "Touhou Wiki: Son Biten":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Son_Biten

title: merlin_prismriver
body:
The "Poltergeist Trumpeter". Middle sister of the Prismriver Sisters, joint Stage 4 bosses of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and individual playable characters of [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

She can play a [[trumpet]] without physical contact, and her music is uplifting in character. She's normally happy-go-lucky, but becomes manic-obsessive over anything that piques her interest.

Merlin is notorious for a programming bug in PCB where she acts erratically during the sisters' final spellcard attack "Ghostly Wheel Wondrous Concerto Grosso", resulting to her portrayal in doujins as rather rebellious. This bug also gave her an "alter-ego" named "Merupo" (めるぽ) - a combination of her name and "nurupo", Japanese shorthand for "null pointer exception") - where her face is replaced with a Shift_JIS smiley face "ξ・∀・）".

She seems to be designated the busty sister as noted by all the pictures.

h4. See also

* [[lunasa_prismriver|Lunasa]], the eldest sister
* [[lyrica_prismriver|Lyrica]], the youngest sister
* [[layla_prismriver|Layla]], the creator of the sisters

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Prismriver Sisters":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Prismriver_Sisters
other_names: メルラン・プリズムリバー

title: lyrica_prismriver
body:
The "Poltergeist Keyboardist". Youngest of the Prismriver Sisters, joint Stage 4 bosses of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and individual playable characters in [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

She can play a keyboard without physical contact, and her music is phantasmagorical in character. Lyrica is smart and strategical, but also manipulative and frequently makes her sisters do the work for her (except in PoFV, where she goes off on her own to find musical material).

h4. See also

* [[lunasa_prismriver|Lunasa]], the eldest sister
* [[merlin_prismriver|Merlin]], the middle sister
* [[layla_prismriver|Layla]], the creator of the sisters

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Prismriver Sisters":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Prismriver_Sisters
other_names: リリカ・プリズムリバー

title: lunasa_prismriver
body:
The "Poltergeist Violinist".

Eldest of the Prismriver Sisters, joint Stage 4 bosses of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]] and later individual playable characters in [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

Lunasa can play her violin without physical contact, and her music is melancholic in character. Honest to a fault and hardworking, Lunasa wants to do things fair and square, but is also a pessimist.

h4. See also

* [[merlin_prismriver|Merlin]], the middle sister
* [[lyrica_prismriver|Lyrica]], the youngest sister
* [[layla_prismriver|Layla]], creator of the sisters

* "Touhou Wiki: Prismriver Sisters":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Prismriver_Sisters

title: layla_prismriver
body:
Creator of [[Touhou]]'s Prismriver Sisters [[lunasa_prismriver|Lunasa]], [[merlin_prismriver|Merlin]] and [[lyrica_prismriver|Lyrica]]. Fourth and youngest sister of the original Prismriver sisters, never officially seen but usually portrayed with [[green hair]] to complement the poltergeists' colors. Layla created the poltergeists in the image of her 3 elder sisters after they parted ways following their father's death. The poltergeists have since survived their "originals" and Layla, and have since found a living as [[Gensokyo]]'s resident musical trio.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Layla Prismriver":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Layla_Prismriver
* "Touhou Wiki: Prismriver Sisters":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Prismriver_Sisters
other_names: レイラ・プリズムリバー

title: letty_whiterock
body:
The "Leftover of Winter". Stage 1 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

A seasonal yuki onna in control of cold, leading to her doujin portrayal as friends with [[Cirno]]. She is only visible during winter, but her status on other times of the year is debatable (either she melts or hibernates somewhere). She is infamous, however, for her large [[hitbox]], which led to jokes about her being [[fat]]. This has lead to pictures of her with a [[curvy]] or [[plump]] figure with [[large breasts]]. The ornament often drawn on her chest is a [[lapel pin]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Letty Whiterock":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Letty_Whiterock]
other_names: レティ・ホワイトロック

title: wheelchair_detective_satori
body:
[[Wheelchair Detective Satori]] is a Horror Comedy [[Touhou]] series, created by a Nico Nico user named [[donjuan]]. It focuses on [[Komeiji Satori]]’s effort to find the culprit behind the accident that put her in a wheelchair.

h4. See also

* [[Murder In Pseudo Paradise]], the sequel series to Wheelchair Detective Satori.

title: kagiyama_hina
body:
The "Nagashi-bina of the Hidden God", originating from [[Touhou]]'s [[Mountain of Faith]] as a stage 2 midboss and boss.

A misfortune goddess with the ability to store up curses. Her movements primarily consist of [[spinning]] around, which is somewhat linked to the kanji for "curse" (厄) resembling a spinning action.

h4. See also

* [[Kuma-hina (31 violence)|]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hina Kagiyama":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hina_Kagiyama

title: mystia_lorelei
body:
The "Night Sparrow." Stage 2 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i] and a playable character in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i].

An egocentric night sparrow youkai who can induce confusion and night-blindness with her song. She dislikes [[yakitori]] (grilled chicken) and has set up a grilled lamprey eel stand in protest, convincing blinded travellers that her eels cure blindness (she cures them on the spot). 

She is best known, however, for having been reputedly devoured by [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] during IN, only to reappear in PoFV, landing her a place in [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of low-tier Touhou characters. Her more recent association with [[Kasodani Kyouko]] as part of [[Choujuu Gigaku]], as well as the increased prominence of her food stand, have loosened her association with Team 9 somewhat.

Contrary to accusations of being illiterate by [[Shameimaru Aya]] in an interview from [[Bohemian Archive in Japanese Red]], she merely has poor eyesight, based an appearance in [[Touhou Sangetsusei]] where she uses a magnifying lens to help her read.

h4. See also

* [[chin-chin]], a phrase commonly associated with Mystia Lorelei
* [[okamisty]], her in a popular fanon work costume
* [[yatai]], the term for her mobile food cart
* [[Choujuu Gigaku]], her band with [[Kasodani Kyouko]] as the other member
* [[Mystia Lorelei (bird)]]
* [[Touhou Mystia's Izakaya]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Mystia Lorelei":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mystia_Lorelei
other_names: ミスティア・ローレライ

title: watatsuki_no_toyohime
body:
A [[Touhou]] character introduced in the manga [[Silent Sinner in Blue]]. Lunarian princess and older sister of [[Watatsuki no Yorihime]]. She has the ability to manipulate boundaries, similar to [[Yakumo Yukari]], but her power is limited to boundaries involving the moon. She has a fan capable of mass destruction (said to be big enough to wipe out the Bamboo Forest completely).

h4. External links

* "Touhou wiki: Watatsuki no Toyohime":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Watatsuki_no_Toyohime

title: watatsuki_no_yorihime
body:
A [[Touhou]] character introduced in the manga [i][[Silent Sinner in Blue]][/i]. A Lunarian princess and younger sister of [[Watatsuki no Toyohime]]. She has the ability to summon the powers of Shinto gods, similar to [[Hakurei Reimu]], but is more skilled at it due to superior experience and training.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Watatsuki no Yorihime":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Watatsuki_no_Yorihime

title: rumia
body:
The "Youkai of the Dusk". Stage 1 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]].

A carnivorous youkai with the ability to manipulate [[darkness]] when attacking humans. She dislikes sunlight, concealing herself in darkness to protect herself, but ends up impairing her own vision, leading her to be portrayed as a member of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]], a posse of childish low-tier Touhou characters.

She is best known for her catchphrase "[[Is that so]]~?" (そーなのかー?, "So-nanoka~?"). The Pixiv tag "毎月七日はルーミアの日":[https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/%E6%AF%8E%E6%9C%88%E4%B8%83%E6%97%A5%E3%81%AF%E3%83%AB%E3%83%BC%E3%83%9F%E3%82%A2%E3%81%AE%E6%97%A5/artworks] ("Maitsuki nanoka ha Rumia no hi" / "The seventh of every month is Rumia day") is a pun off of her catchphrase, since "nanoka" can also mean "七日" ("seventh day"). She is often drawn with her [[spread arms|arms spread]] in a "crucifixion" pose.

On occasion, she is depicted completely surrounded by [[darkness]], flying around as a solid black sphere with only the presence of her catchphrase or her ribbon sticking out from the darkness identifying her.

h4. See also

* [[is that so]]
* [[Team 9 (touhou)|]]
* [[Ex-Rumia]]
* [[Rumia (darkness)]]
* [[Druma (eveiira)]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Rumia":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Rumia
other_names: 毎月七日はルーミアの日

title: medicine_melancholy
body:
The "Little Sweet Poison". Introduced in [[Touhou]]'s [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] as a playable character.

A [[doll]] youkai once abandoned amidst a field of [[poison]]ous [[lily of the valley]] flowers. While not particularly experienced, her poison and technique make her a formidable opponent. She dislikes humans and advocates emancipation of dolls (despite the fact that she is the only sentient doll).

Despite fanworks portraying her as friends or shipped with [[Kazami Yuuka]] the two have been shown to get along very poorly in [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]], alongside doing [[role reversal]] when it comes to fanon, having her against Yuuka will make the latter tear up and get clothing damage, being one of the very few younger characters to do so. Seemingly gets on very well with [[Yagokoro Eirin]], to the point it's speculated she now works at [[Eientei]] as a part-time anesthesiologist.

Generally assumed to live on the [[Nameless Hill]].

h4. See also

* [[Su-san]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Medicine Melancholy":[http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Medicine_Melancholy]
other_names: メディスン・メランコリー

title: chen
body:
The "Black Cat of Bad Omens". Stage 2 midboss and boss, as well as Extra Stage midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]].

She is the [[cat girl|nekomata]] shikigami of [[Yakumo Ran]] (who is herself the shikigami of [[Yakumo Yukari]]). Despite her knowledge of black magic, Chen is rather weak by herself, only gaining a massive increase in power in the presence of her master. She is also weakened by water. Like Ran, Chen is actually the shikigami spirit possessing the nekomata, although she appears to have only a partial hold on her host and doesn't suppress the host's personality, resulting in Chen as a character being a symbiosis between the two.

Fanworks frequently portray her as a daughter figure to Ran, often exuding a level of cuteness that often gives her [[excessive nosebleed|epic nosebleeds]]. She is also considered an honorary member of [[Team 9 (touhou)|]] in some fanwork circles. She appears to have befriended [[Kaenbyou Rin]] in [[Foul Detective Satori]], who has passed on her habit of finding and retrieving dead bodies.

h4. See also

* [[Chen (cat)]]
* "Nyan Clan of Gensokyo":/pools/17046

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Chen]

title: moriya_suwako
body:
The "Epitome of Native Gods" (土着神の頂点).

Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]] game number 10, [i][[Mountain of Faith]][/i] and later a playable character in Touhou 12.3 [i][[touhou_hisoutensoku|Hisoutensoku]][/i]. 

Mountain goddess and original patron deity of the Moriya Shrine before losing it to [[Yasaka Kanako]], but has remained a fixture in the shrine. She has the power to create earth. Direct ancestor of the shrine's miko, [[Kochiya Sanae]]. Suwako joined Sanae and Kanako upon moving into [[Gensokyo]], although she is less troubled by the waning faith of people from the outside world than the latter two.

"Suwako is a god that takes the form of a frog". Her dress, her move in Hisoutensoku, and fanarts heavily depict this fact. This led to Kanako adopting snakes as her motif, symbolizing her victory over Suwako.

Her hat has almost become an entity of its own in fanarts, due to the imposing, leering eyes on top of it.

h4. See also

* [[Yasaka Kanako]] - fellow goddess of the Moriya Shrine
* [[Kochiya Sanae]] - descendant and shrine maiden
* [[Pyonta]] - Suwako's hat. Only use when hat acting independently of Suwako.
* [[Moriya's Iron Rings]] - Suwako's weapons
* [[Mishaguji]] - Suwako's underlings

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Suwako Moriya":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Suwako_Moriya

title: yoshida_hirofumi
body:
Hirofumi Yoshida is a character in [[Chainsaw Man]] is a Private Devil Hunter. Together with [[Kusakabe (Chainsaw Man)|]] and [[Tamaoki (Chainsaw Man)|]], he is considered by [[Makima (Chainsaw Man)|]] as a high-class bodyguard specialist. He is also a member of an organization that tasked him with keeping [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] safe. He is a part of the Devil Hunter Club alongside with [[Mitaka Asa]] and [[Yuko (Chainsaw Man)|]]

Yoshida has a contract with the [[Octopus Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]] for an unknown price.

title: tanaka_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Mr. Tanaka a character from the manga series [[Chainsaw Man]] is a teacher of [[Mitaka Asa]]'s class.

Mr. Tanaka is a kind man who values life and the well being of his students. He took special care to make sure [[Mitaka Asa]] felt included in the class, including asking the [[Class President (Chainsaw Man)|]] to befriend her and apologizing to the class on her behalf for the death of [[Bucky (Chainsaw Man)|]].

However, he may have been more unscrupulous then he seemed, as it was later revealed that he was sleeping with the [[Class President (Chainsaw Man)|]] despite their age difference and student-teacher relationship.

After [[Yoru (Chainsaw Man)|]] first arrives, she ripped off Mr. Tanaka's head, turning it into the "Tanaka Spinal Cord Sword". Most of his appearance in fanart is of the sword.

body:

title: kishibe_(young)_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The extra pages of [[Chainsaw Man]] Volume 8 show a young [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] trying to ask out [[Quanxi (Chainsaw Man)|]] for a date and gets hit every time he asks that.

But after asking relentlessly to date [[Quanxi (Chainsaw Man)|]] for 9 years and even confessing his feelings for her, Kishibe gets rejected as [[Quanxi (Chainsaw Man)|]] says she might be into girls. To which [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] says that he knew all along. The extra also tells us that both [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] and [[Quanxi (Chainsaw Man)|]] used to be partners.

This tag only applies if the pic shows the younger version of [[Kishibe (Chainsaw Man)|]] who has [[Black Hair]] and usually doesn't have a [[scar]].

title: santa_claus_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Character from the manga series [[Chainsaw Man]]. A global hive mind of perfect doll assassins, indistinguishable from regular humans, controlled by one individual with the help of the [[Doll Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]].

One of the perfect dolls of Santa Claus is a short, mostly bald elderly man with a thin mustache and beard, which became known as the [[Santa Claus of Germany (Chainsaw Man)|]].

[spoiler]In exchange for bringing [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] to Hell, the [[Darkness Devil]] gave Santa Claus a small piece of its flesh to ingest, which gave her a boost in several abilities and transformed her into a [[Darkness Flesh (Chainsaw Man)|Devil.]] [/spoiler]

h4. Related characters

* [[Tolka (Chainsaw Man)|]]

title: sinclair_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.11 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on the narrator of the 20th century bildungsroman "Demian":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demian written by "Hermann Hesse":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hermann_Hesse.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], [[black coat]], but replaces the [[black vest]] with [[suspenders]] and additionally wears a pair of [[black gloves]].

He wields a large [[halberd]] with the German word 'Vogel' ('Bird' in English) written on the blade in his base identity.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026028: [[Official art]]

title: outis_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.12. Based on the main character "Odysseus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odysseus from the ancient Greek epic poem "The Odyssey":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odyssey written by the poet "Homer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homer.

She has [[dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], wears [[multiple earrings]] and a broken [[wristwatch]] which she retains across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but replaces the [[black coat]] with a [[black jacket]]. 

She wields a [[falcata]] in her base identity, with the Greek word 'Ουτις' ('Nobody' In English) etched into the blade.

h4. Official art

* !post #5025978: [[Official art]]

title: gregor_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.13 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based off of the main protagonist of the 20th century novella "The Metamorphosis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Metamorphosis written by German author "Franz Kafka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Franz_Kafka.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] kept in a [[low ponytail]], a massive [[arthropod limbs|insectile claw]] in place of his right arm (which he retains, [[prosthetic arm|replaces]] or has [[amputee|amputated]] across all of his identities and [[e.g.o (project moon)|E.G.O]]), a [[tattoo]] on his [[arm tattoo|left arm]], wears [[semi-rimless eyewear]], [[smoking|smokes]] [[cigarette|cigarettes]], and is almost always accompanied by a [[cockroach]]. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but has [[short sleeves]] and excludes the [[black coat]]. 

His right arm is a massive [[arthropod limbs|insectile claw]] that he uses as his primary weapon in his base identity, while his left arm is tattooed with the German word 'UNGEZIEFER' ('Vermin' In English). 

h4. Official art

* !post #5026004

title: meursault_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.05 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based off of the main protagonist of the 20th century novella "The Stranger":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Stranger_(Camus_novel) written by French author "Albert Camus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Camus.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[hair slicked back|slicked]] [[black hair]], [[green eyes]], a constant [[expressionless|perpetual frown]], and wears a unique [[belt]] across all of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but excludes the [[black coat]] and wears a unique [[belt]]. 

He wears two metal [[gauntlets]] in his base identity, with the French word 'SOLEIL' ('SUN' in English) upon his right [[single gauntlet|gauntlet]].

h4. Official art

title: katano_sukune
body:
The "Pure and Genius Haniwa". Stage 5 boss of [[Earthen Miraculous Sword]] and later a recurring playable character.

An [[androgynous]] haniwa who's a famous artisan. Has the power to model anything into shapes, such as clay, earth or ice.

Sukune has an energetic, positive personality, yet they're also a bit eccentric. They talk in a weird speech that they have invented themself for the sake of being creative, adding lots of verbal tics to their speech, such as "gyuu" and "nyo". Sukune is also described as a kindhearted simpleton by many people, to the point of befriending the asocial [[Adagumo no Yaorochi]].

h4. Official art

title: senri_tsurubami
body:
The "Inexplicable Hakama". Extra boss of [[Evanescent Existence]].

An [[androgynous]] priest who used to be the protector of the land of Mugenri together with their best friend [[Zuifeng Tenkai]]. The two ruled with an iron fist until Tsurubami decided to leave for the Outside World and spirited away [[Houlen Yabusame]] and [[Enraku Tsubakura]] to become their temporary replacements.

Tsurubami is a confident, energetic and dutiful person who tends to get carried away easily. They're prone to start arguing, become outraged, or even attack someone for incomprehensible reasons. Despite this, they are devoted to their job as the Senri priest, though they're still too willful and inconsiderate of others.

h4. Official art

* !post #1663698

h4. External links

* "Len'en Wiki: Tsurubami Senri":http://lenen.shoutwiki.com/wiki/Tsurubami_Senri

An aloof, [[androgynous]] scientist who was abducted by [[Senri Tsurubami]] to work as a replacement priest in the land of Mugenri. Tsubakura doesn't have innate magical or supernatural abilities, instead using technology and weapons to fight.

An [[androgynous]] human who was abducted by [[Senri Tsurubami]] to the land of Mugenri. While originally a normal human, they gained the power to control gravity. Goes by the full (fake) name "Wilhelm von Clausewitz Halcyon HISUIMARU".

Clause is shown to be an arrogant, impulsive person who talks in strange metaphors. Most people treat them as a nuisance and hate Clause upon their first meeting.

title: caipirinha_(meme)
body:
A dance [[meme]] from the 2000s with various characters from different series. Their actions consist of wagging their finger and shaking their hips, to the tune of a Japanese trance remix of German artist Carinho's song, appearing on [[EXIT TRANCE]] PRESENTS ウマウマできるトランスを作ってみた2 作者は病気シリーズ, under the name "ぷんちきぱやっぱーヾ(ﾟ∀ﾟ)ﾉ♪ ([i]punchiki-payappaa[/i])."

This action sequence was done in one of the scenes from the series [[Azumanga Daioh]], where [[Takino Tomo]] is berating [[Mihama Chiyo]] for being childish.

In Brazil, Caipirinha is a national cocktail, made with cachaça, sugar and lime.

h4. See also

title: navia_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character from Fontaine. The current president of the company Spina di Rosula, a position she inherited from her father, Callas, after his death. Despite losing many of her loved ones along the way, Navia continues pushing on, with the story serving as a coming-of-age story for her.

Her Vision element is Geo, and she wields a claymore and her Gunbrella in battle, the latter of which is a parasol equipped with a cannon.

title: hijiri_byakuren
body:
[[Touhou]] character. Her title is The Sealed Great Magician. She was introduced into the series as the final boss of [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A Buddhist magician whose younger brother [[Hijiri Myouren|Myouren]]'s traumatic death drove her to seek agelessness, as well as a pacifist who believes in equality between humans and youkai. Once sealed in Makai by humans (where many think she made friends with and learned spellcards from [[Shinki (touhou)|]]), but was freed during Undefined Fantastic Object by her followers [[Toramaru Shou]], [[Murasa Minamitsu]] and [[Kumoi Ichirin]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[gradient hair]] that goes from [[purple_hair|purple]] to [[brown_hair|brown]]. Many fans were confused if her hair was either gradient or if the purple was just from the lighting coming from her [[Sorcerer's Sutra Scroll|scroll]]. ZUN has confirmed that her hair is indeed naturally gradient. All clothes she is depicted wearing are always criss-crossed. In [[Hopeless Masquerade]] she is depicted with an [[ajirogasa]] hat and a [[necklace]] of [[prayer beads]]. In [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] she gets a [[bikesuit]] along with her own motorcycle.

See also [[namusanbou]] which tends to be associated with her because of her stage 6 dialogue.

h4.Game appearances

* [[Undefined Fantastic Object]] (Final boss)
* [[Double Spoiler]] (Scene 12-1, 12-3, 12-5, 12-7 Boss)
* [[Hopeless Masquerade]] (Playable character, one of the assisting final bosses in [[Hata no Kokoro]]'s scenario)
* [[Impossible Spell Card]] (10th Day Boss)
* [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] (Playable character)

h4.Examples

* !post #2772756: Usual appearance [br] ([[Undefined Fantastic Object]])
* !post #2666862: Alternate appearance [br] ([[Hopeless Masquerade]], [[Urban Legend in Limbo]], [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]])
* !post #3684818: [[Turbo Byakuren]] [br] ([[Urban Legend in Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]])

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Byakuren Hijiri":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Byakuren_Hijiri

title: chinese_divers_princess_carry_(meme)
body:
A famous photo from the [[2024 Summer Olympics]] where Chinese springboard diving gold medalists Chen Yiwen and Chang Yani celebrated their victory by doing a [[princess carry]], much to the astonishment of the American silver medalist Kassidy Cook.

title: don't_dead_open_inside
body:
A [[meme]] which revolves around multi-line text (typically four-word phrases) arranged in a manner where it is unclear whether the words should be read in "row-major or column-major order":https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Row_and_column_major_order.svg.

The name originates from a promotional poster for [i][[The Walking Dead]][/i] which depicts a double-door with the words 'don't open' 'dead inside' grouped into columns written on the two door panels, such that it reads horizontally as 'don't dead' 'open inside'.

The meme saw renewed interest with the more recent [i]Sasa Lele[/i] example, as featured in post #4626342.

title: pinky_swear
body: When two people link their pinky fingers, typically to signify that a promise has been made, or as a way to show affection in a less obvious manner.
